frameworks_mode.meaning: Treat selected CRT-REQ requirement sets as the primary requirements lens (still structurally mapped via CRT-C).

default_lens_context.meaning: Include the shipped default lens context across the CRT spine (broad, baseline scope).

resolved_semantics.notes: Semantics are resolved for downstream interpretation. Do not re-infer from keys.

mapping_guidance.crt_spine_principle: CRT-C is the primary spine. All other catalogues are interpreted through CRT-C mappings.
primary_focus_order: 3) crt_backbone.crt_f_in_scope_records (derived from CRT-C mapped_failure_ids; full CRT-F rows attached)
4) crt_backbone.crt_n_in_scope_records (derived from CRT-C mapped_compensation_ids; full CRT-N rows attached)
6) structural lens bundles in verified.bundle.structural_lenses (additional emphasis, not exclusion)
mapping_guidance.how_to_use_emphasis: Emphasis means 'start here and go deeper'. It does NOT mean other context is false or excluded. Where an anchor-mapped control set exists (STD/POL), it is treated as the tight authoritative scope.
mapping_guidance.note_on_local_paths: json_path fields are traceability references to the local workspace. External AI cannot open them. Reason only from embedded records/subsets included in this verified artefact.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization manages information system accounts, including identification, authorization, and monitoring.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to user/privileged access lifecycle controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to resources.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns with access governance and enforcement controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization separates duties to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to privilege segmentation and access governance.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization employs the principle of least privilege for system access.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to least-privilege provisioning and access restrictions.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The information system enforces a limit of consecutive invalid login attempts.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to authentication monitoring and lockout controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization determines and logs events required for auditing.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to audit event capture and log configuration.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Audit records contain sufficient detail for analysis.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns with logging sufficiency and traceability.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization reviews and analyzes audit logs for inappropriate activity.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to audit monitoring and alert analysis.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system uses internal or external time sources for audit timestamps.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports log integrity and temporal consistency.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization centrally manages audit logs.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to log retention and central monitoring tools.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops and documents baseline configurations.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to configuration baselines and secure defaults.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Changes to the system are formally managed and approved.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to controlled change procedures and approvals.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization establishes and enforces configuration settings.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to system hardening and secure configuration.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system is configured to only provide essential capabilities.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to reducing attack surface via minimal services.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops and maintains an inventory of system components.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to asset inventory and dependency listings.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops a contingency plan for system recovery.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to continuity and recovery planning.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization tests contingency plans to determine effectiveness.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to continuity assurance testing.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization identifies alternate storage sites.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports resilience and data redundancy.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization identifies alternate processing sites.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to operational continuity capabilities.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization provides for system recovery and reconstitution.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to backup and recovery operations.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system uniquely identifies and authenticates users.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to identity proofing and credential use.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization manages authentication devices and credentials.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to MFA and credential lifecycle.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system authenticates non-organizational users.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to third-party and federated identity controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Users re-authenticate under specified conditions.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to session timeout and re-authentication.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization establishes identity proofing for users.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to identity vetting and onboarding.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization trains personnel in incident response roles.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to detection/response readiness controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization implements an incident handling capability.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to investigation and containment controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization tracks and documents incidents.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports incident tracking and response workflows.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization reports incidents to appropriate authorities.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to reporting and notification processes.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops an incident response plan.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to IR governance and planning.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization protects digital and non-digital media during transport.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to data handling and media protection.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization sanitizes and disposes of media securely.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to secure destruction and sanitization.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Media is sanitized prior to reuse.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns with classification and sanitization controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization implements physical access controls for facilities.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to physical protection and access oversight.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Physical access is monitored for unauthorized activity.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to surveillance and access logging.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Visitors and maintenance personnel are monitored while inside facilities.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports visitor tracking and oversight.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Emergency lighting is provided for essential operations.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports continuity and resilience.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system provides emergency shutoff capability.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to facility risk controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops and maintains system security plans.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to governance, documentation, and oversight.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization establishes rules describing responsibilities and expected behavior.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Relates to user governance and expectations.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization develops an information security architecture.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to architectural governance.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization conducts risk assessments to identify threats and vulnerabilities.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to risk identification and appraisal.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization scans for vulnerabilities and takes action.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to vulnerability detection and remediation.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization follows a defined system development life cycle.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to secure development practices.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Security requirements are incorporated into system acquisitions.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports secure procurement.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: Developers test systems for security flaws.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to secure testing and defect remediation.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system monitors and controls communications at its external boundary.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns with perimeter and network management.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system uses approved cryptographic key management.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Supports encryption and key management controls.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The system protects the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Maps to encryption and data protection.

records_in_scope.requirement_text: The organization identifies, reports, and corrects system flaws.
records_in_scope.rationale_summary: Aligns to vulnerability remediation and patching controls.

crt_req.scope_note: AI should reason primarily from records_in_scope. catalogue_meta is informational only.

records_in_scope.obligation_description: Maintain governance arrangements for oversight of cyber, technology, and operational resilience risks.
records_in_scope.source_reference_examples: DORA Art.17; MAS TRM Ch.3; PRA SS1/21

records_in_scope.obligation_description: Define and maintain clear roles, responsibilities, and accountability for security and resilience activities.
Provide senior leadership with regular security, risk, and resilience reporting.
Maintain a structured process for assessing security and resilience risks.
Identify key internal and external dependencies supporting critical services.
Perform scenario exercises covering severe but plausible disruptions.
Maintain internal escalation and communication procedures for cyber and operational incidents.
Ensure disaster recovery capabilities for critical systems are maintained and periodically validated.
Define acceptable levels of disruption for key services and ensure supporting controls align.
Maintain oversight and monitoring of privileged access usage.
Review and validate user access rights regularly for appropriateness.
Maintain an inventory of technology assets supporting key services.
Ensure appropriate measures exist for protecting sensitive or critical data.
Maintain classification and handling rules for sensitive information.
Notify affected parties of data breaches when required by risk or regulation.
Maintain and enforce retention and destruction requirements for data.
Evaluate supplier security posture as part of onboarding and ongoing review.
Identify and manage concentration risks in the supply chain.
Maintain monitoring and logging across systems supporting critical services.
Detect anomalous or suspicious activity across key systems.
Retain monitoring and logging evidence for required durations.
Maintain documentation demonstrating the organisation's resilience posture.
Provide evidence of controls, risk assessments, testing, and governance when requested.
Provide annual attestation on the adequacy of security and resilience practices.
Ensure personnel receive periodic security awareness training.
Provide training relevant to privileged or specialist roles.
Maintain mechanisms for identifying abnormal user behaviour or insider risks.
Provide individuals with clear, accessible information about what personal data is collected, why it is collected, how it is used, and who it is shared with.
Define and apply retention periods so personal data is not kept longer than necessary for business or legal purposes.
records_in_scope.source_reference_examples: GDPR Art.5(1)(e); UK DPA; global practice

records_in_scope.obligation_description: Take reasonable steps to keep personal data accurate and up to date, including mechanisms for correction.
Ensure third parties processing personal data provide adequate contractual, technical, and organisational safeguards.
records_in_scope.evidence_required: Data processing agreements, due diligence records

records_in_scope.obligation_description: Apply appropriate technical and organisational measures to preserve confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data.
Maintain processes to detect, assess, internally report, and document personal-data breaches.

crt_lr.scope_note: AI should reason primarily from records_in_scope. catalogue_meta is informational only.

records.description: Safeguards information assets across storage, processing, and transmission environments. Focus areas: classification, encryption, retention, and confidentiality.
Manages authentication, authorisation, and trust boundaries across systems, users, and devices. Includes IAM, MFA, and privilege control.
Addresses resilience of networks, infrastructure, and connectivity layers ‚Äî including segmentation, hardening, and telemetry assurance.
Focuses on software development, integration security, dependency management, and lifecycle assurance across APIs and applications.
Covers supplier oversight, contractual assurance, dependency mapping, and transitive risk evaluation.
Examines insider threats, culture, awareness, and human-centred risk mechanisms influencing system exposure.
Ensures conformance with frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST CSF, DORA), audit readiness, and governance accountability.
Controls for AI, IoT, blockchain, and systemic-risk resilience.
Controls supporting detection, coordination, and incident recovery.
Controls governing facility access, environmental protection, and redundancy.
Structured method to categorise information assets (Public, Internal, Confidential etc.) ensuring proportional protection by sensitivity and operational impact.
records.objective: Provide consistent basis for applying controls aligned to data value and exposure risk.
records.key_challenges: Misclassification, inconsistent enforcement, metadata gaps.
records.strategic_risks: Data leakage, insider misuse, regulatory exposure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Hybrid (on-prem + SaaS); moderate interdependence risk; governance fragmentation possible without central registry.
records.rationale_summary: Classification errors or governance gaps cause mis-labelling and control drift; metadata loss reduces enforcement consistency.
records.observations: Foundational control; metadata consistency is vital for downstream DLP and retention accuracy.

records.description: Protects stored data through cryptographic methods that prevent unauthorised disclosure or tampering on physical or virtual media.
records.objective: Preserve confidentiality and integrity of data at rest across systems and devices.
records.key_challenges: Key management complexity, performance impact, legacy storage compatibility.
records.strategic_risks: Data breach, loss of customer trust, compliance penalties.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applies to on-prem servers, cloud storage, and portable devices; requires alignment with encryption standards and HSM policies.
records.rationale_summary: Encryption fails if keys are mishandled, algorithms outdated, or governance reviews lapse.
records.observations: Essential baseline control; encryption efficacy depends on secure key lifecycle management.

records.description: Ensures confidentiality and integrity of data while moving across networks through TLS, VPN, and secure protocols.
records.objective: Prevent interception, man-in-the-middle attacks, and tampering during transmission.
records.key_challenges: Certificate management, deprecated protocol use, misconfigured endpoints.
records.strategic_risks: Information disclosure, session hijacking, data manipulation.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All connectivity models; critical for remote and cloud services where data crosses untrusted networks.
records.rationale_summary: Weak encryption during transit exposes data via integration drift or cryptographic deprecation.
records.observations: Complementary to encryption at rest; requires ongoing certificate and protocol governance.

records.description: Monitors and controls data movement from endpoints to external devices or cloud services to prevent unauthorised exfiltration.
records.objective: Identify and block risky data transfers in real time while supporting business operations.
records.key_challenges: False positives, user workarounds, policy complexity.
records.strategic_risks: Unnoticed data leakage, shadow IT usage, privacy breach.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Endpoint and hybrid work environments; visibility must extend to BYOD and remote agents.
records.rationale_summary: DLP mis-tags or user fatigue undermine endpoint protection and enforcement coverage.
records.observations: Enhances classification controls; effectiveness depends on clear policy definition and user training.

records.description: Implements checksum, hashing, and change-control mechanisms to detect unauthorised data alteration or corruption.
records.objective: Ensure accuracy and authenticity of stored or transmitted data.
records.key_challenges: Integration with existing systems, alert fatigue, limited coverage of unstructured data.
records.strategic_risks: Data tampering, fraud, loss of audit integrity.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applicable across hybrid environments; monitoring should cover critical data repositories and APIs.
records.rationale_summary: Gaps in logging or late detection obscure tampering and distort integrity metrics.
records.observations: Complements encryption controls by detecting unauthorised modification post-access.

records.description: Defines how long data is kept and how it is securely deleted once no longer needed to reduce legal and operational exposure.
records.objective: Minimise risk through controlled retention cycles and verifiable destruction methods.
records.key_challenges: Inconsistent policy application, backup retention gaps, jurisdictional requirements.
records.strategic_risks: Over-retention, data spillage from legacy systems, non-compliance with privacy laws.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Hybrid storage models; requires alignment with records-management and legal retention policies.
records.rationale_summary: Out-of-date or mis-applied retention rules leave residual sensitive data or hinder recovery.
records.observations: Supports ‚Äúprivacy by design‚Äù; critical for demonstrable compliance and data minimisation.

records.description: Requires two or more independent authentication factors to verify user identity, reducing credential-based compromise.
records.objective: Strengthen identity assurance and limit exploitation of stolen or weak credentials.
records.key_challenges: User friction, inconsistent rollout, legacy-system compatibility.
records.strategic_risks: Credential theft, privilege escalation, unauthorised access.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Cloud and hybrid environments; essential for remote and privileged accounts.
records.rationale_summary: MFA weakens through token reuse, poor policy alignment, or federation mis-validation.
records.observations: Baseline access-control safeguard; strongest when paired with adaptive authentication.

records.description: Enforces role-, attribute-, or context-based permissions to restrict actions to the minimum necessary.
records.objective: Prevent privilege misuse through precise, condition-aware access logic.
records.key_challenges: Policy sprawl, rule conflicts, dynamic-context evaluation overhead.
records.strategic_risks: Excessive privilege, insider abuse, regulatory non-compliance.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise and cloud platforms; critical where APIs expose granular functions.
records.rationale_summary: Overlapping or unreviewed access rules create privilege creep and loss of least-privilege control.
records.observations: Core component of zero-trust architecture; depends on accurate identity context.

records.description: Establishes trust and governance for third-party and federated identities across multiple domains or organisations.
records.objective: Enable secure collaboration while maintaining consistent authentication and audit control.
records.key_challenges: Identity-provider misalignment, token-lifetime management, contractual oversight.
records.strategic_risks: Supply-chain exposure, cross-domain breach propagation, loss of identity integrity.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Common in hybrid cloud and multi-tenant ecosystems; relies on federation standards (OAuth, SAML, OIDC).
records.rationale_summary: Extends zero-trust boundaries externally; demands rigorous token and claim validation. Federation de-provisioning eliminates dormant partner credentials.
records.observations: Extends zero-trust boundaries externally; demands rigorous token and claim validation.

records.description: Governs, monitors, and audits administrative and high-privilege accounts to prevent misuse or compromise.
records.objective: Restrict and record privileged actions through controlled elevation and session management.
records.key_challenges: Tool complexity, credential vault maintenance, integration overhead.
records.strategic_risks: Catastrophic system takeover, data breach, compliance failure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Hybrid and cloud infrastructures; essential for administrative and service accounts.
records.rationale_summary: High-impact privileges demand consistent review; audit or ownership lapses invite escalation misuse.
records.observations: Central pillar of access governance; enables forensic replay and continuous monitoring.

records.description: Automates and governs creation, modification, and removal of user identities throughout their lifecycle.
records.objective: Ensure timely provisioning and de-provisioning to reduce orphan accounts and privilege creep.
records.key_challenges: Integration with HR systems, manual on/off-boarding, shadow accounts.
records.strategic_risks: Excess access, insider threat, audit failure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All environments; critical for federated and cloud directory services.
records.rationale_summary: Unrevoked or residual accounts and unmanaged tools extend trust beyond intended scope. Account-revocation and entitlement tracking close residual trust gaps.
records.observations: Provides foundation for authorisation accuracy and regulatory traceability.

records.description: Establishes requirements for password length, complexity, rotation, and storage to reduce credential compromise.
records.objective: Mitigate password-related breach vectors through hardened credential standards.
records.key_challenges: User fatigue, reuse across systems, insecure storage.
records.strategic_risks: Account takeover, phishing success, credential stuffing.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Universal control; applies to all auth mechanisms including service accounts.
records.rationale_summary: Weak or reused credentials, combined with user fatigue, create recurring compromise vectors.
records.observations: Foundational but diminishing as passwordless approaches mature; remains baseline for legacy systems.

records.description: Establishes encrypted, policy-controlled remote access using VPN or Zero-Trust Network Access (ZTNA) architectures.
records.objective: Safeguard remote connections by verifying user, device, and session context before granting network access.
records.key_challenges: Credential leakage, weak endpoint posture checks, performance degradation.
records.strategic_risks: Network intrusion, lateral movement, data exfiltration.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Essential for hybrid and remote-work models; aligns with zero-trust segmentation principles.
records.rationale_summary: Weak configuration or external-provider dependencies expose remote channels to misuse.
records.observations: Foundational for secure hybrid operations; integrates with MFA and endpoint-health telemetry.

records.description: Divides networks into security zones to limit lateral movement and isolate critical assets.
records.objective: Contain breaches and enforce least-privilege connectivity.
records.key_challenges: Over-segmentation complexity, firewall rule management, visibility gaps.
records.strategic_risks: Unchecked spread of malware, privilege escalation, operational downtime.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Core to on-prem and hybrid architectures; must integrate with identity-aware routing.
records.rationale_summary: Poorly maintained segments or elevated privileges can erode isolation boundaries.
records.observations: Structural defence mechanism; supports resilience by compartmentalising compromise impact.

records.description: Implements strong encryption (WPA3), network segmentation, and access control for wireless networks.
records.objective: Protect data in transit and prevent rogue-access-point intrusion.
records.key_challenges: Legacy devices, credential sharing, guest-network isolation.
records.strategic_risks: Eavesdropping, credential harvesting, local breach propagation.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Office and branch environments; applies to IoT and BYOD contexts.
records.rationale_summary: Mis-set SSIDs, weak policies, or inattentive users create broadcast and interception risks.
records.observations: Baseline physical-layer safeguard; complements remote-access and segmentation controls.

records.description: Restricts or secures direct exposure of internal services to public networks through reverse-proxies, firewalls, or CASB controls.
records.objective: Reduce external attack surface and minimise unauthorised ingress/egress paths.
records.key_challenges: Misconfigured firewalls, inconsistent cloud security-groups, shadow endpoints.
records.strategic_risks: Data breach, ransomware infiltration, DDoS exposure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Cloud and internet-facing infrastructure; relies on continuous attack-surface management.
records.rationale_summary: Internet-facing assets require continuous validation; drift or failed recovery opens attack surface.
records.observations: Often overlooked in hybrid setups; provides measurable reduction in exposure footprint.

records.control_name: Secure DNS and Network Traffic Monitoring
records.description: Utilises DNS filtering, anomaly detection, and encrypted-traffic inspection to identify malicious communication patterns.
records.objective: Detect command-and-control or data-exfiltration activity early.
records.key_challenges: Encrypted-traffic visibility, privacy balance, tuning alert thresholds.
records.strategic_risks: Stealth malware persistence, delayed incident detection, lateral compromise.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Network and cloud gateways; dependent on robust telemetry pipelines.
records.rationale_summary: Logging and detection lag obscure DNS tunnelling or anomalous traffic patterns.
records.observations: Enhances situational awareness; key telemetry feed for AI Observation Console.

records.description: Defines redundancy, failover, and capacity-planning strategies to sustain critical services under fault or attack.
records.objective: Maintain operational continuity through engineered resilience and contingency design.
records.key_challenges: Cost constraints, configuration drift, dependency under-mapping.
records.strategic_risks: Service outage, cascading failure, recovery-time breach.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All infrastructures; vital for regulated and mission-critical environments.
records.rationale_summary: Concentrated hosting or untested recovery plans amplify outage and continuity risks.
records.observations: Forms the backbone of recovery architecture; links with metrics dashboard and simulation engine.

records.description: Establishes and maintains hardened technical baselines for systems, platforms, and cloud services, covering configuration, time synchronisation, service exposure, authentication, logging, and protocol governance. Ensures baselines are version-controlled, enforced, monitored for drift, and aligned with organisational policies, risk expectations, and regulatory requirements.
records.objective: Provide a consistent, measurable, and enforceable foundation of secure configuration across all technology stacks, enabling early detection of misconfiguration, reducing attack surface, and supporting forensic traceability and operational integrity.
records.key_challenges: Configuration drift across environments; inconsistent baseline ownership; legacy platforms; cloud/modern stack complexity; lack of automated compliance tooling; gaps between policy requirements and platform enforcement.
records.strategic_risks: Privilege escalation; silent misconfiguration; timestamp inaccuracies; log integrity failures; broadened attack surface; exploitation of insecure defaults; systemic weaknesses enabling lateral movement.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Configuration drift across environments; inconsistent baseline ownership; legacy platform variance; cloud/provider abstraction gaps; lack of automated compliance validation.
records.rationale_summary: Misconfigured or unmaintained baselines introduce systemic weaknesses that attackers exploit before higher-order controls activate. Baseline governance ensures technical foundations remain secure, coherent, and aligned with risk posture.
records.observations: Baseline governance is frequently assumed but rarely implemented consistently; automated compliance drift detection is essential; forms the connective tissue between policy intent, standards, and operational reality.

records.description: Implements authentication, rate limiting, and payload validation at the API boundary to prevent unauthorised access and abuse.
records.objective: Safeguard data exchange between internal and external services through consistent policy enforcement.
records.key_challenges: Token leakage, inconsistent API versioning, weak logging visibility.
records.strategic_risks: Data exposure, privilege escalation, dependency exploitation.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Cloud-native and hybrid integration layers; applies to microservice and B2B interfaces.
records.rationale_summary: Gateways fail when integrations drift, vendor endpoints misalign, or trust boundaries blur.
records.observations: Cornerstone of integration security; API misuse often leads to systemic compromise if not monitored continuously.

records.description: Integrates security activities‚Äîthreat modelling, code review, dependency scanning‚Äîthroughout the development lifecycle.
records.objective: Identify and remediate vulnerabilities early in design and build stages.
records.key_challenges: Developer engagement, tooling consistency, dependency management.
records.strategic_risks: Vulnerable releases, regulatory exposure, reputational loss.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise development pipelines, DevSecOps, and third-party software integration.
records.rationale_summary: Development control lapses and poor update discipline allow latent defects and stale playbooks. Development pipelines enforce pre-deployment validation and rollback discipline.
records.observations: Foundational for shift-left resilience; reinforces secure culture within engineering teams.

records.description: Enforces identity-aware, role-based access rules at the application tier independent of network perimeter.
records.objective: Prevent unauthorised access and privilege misuse within application logic.
records.key_challenges: Policy granularity, custom code bypasses, decentralised access checks.
records.strategic_risks: Data manipulation, privilege abuse, business-logic exploitation.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Web, SaaS, and internal apps; integral to zero-trust models.
records.rationale_summary: Weak or misaligned logic in app-layer roles allows privilege overlap and trust gaps.
records.observations: Complements MFA and fine-grained authorisation; enforces least privilege at transaction level.

records.description: Evaluates the security posture, dependency mapping, and data exposure of integrated third-party applications.
records.objective: Identify and manage risk introduced by external APIs, plug-ins, and SaaS dependencies.
records.key_challenges: Vendor visibility, version drift, lack of contractual assurances.
records.strategic_risks: Supply-chain compromise, data leakage, compliance gap.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Common across SaaS and hybrid ecosystems; should align with vendor-risk framework.
records.rationale_summary: Unvetted integrations introduce external exposure and governance ambiguity.
records.observations: Directly supports vendor-risk domain; cross-links to CRT-C-0025 (Third-Party Risk Assessment Framework).

records.description: Filters, monitors, and blocks malicious HTTP/S traffic using rule-based and behavioural analytics.
records.objective: Protect public-facing web applications from injection, cross-site scripting, and protocol abuse.
records.key_challenges: False positives, bypass through obfuscation, rule maintenance.
records.strategic_risks: Web defacement, data exfiltration, downtime from exploit attempts.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Internet-facing assets and reverse proxies; integrates with CDN and SIEM.
records.rationale_summary: Misconfigured WAF rules or overreliance on detection cause coverage gaps.
records.observations: Critical control for exposed services; functions best when linked to continuous vulnerability management.

records.description: Ensures all user inputs are validated and outputs encoded to prevent injection or cross-site scripting attacks.
records.objective: Maintain integrity of application data flow and user-facing content.
records.key_challenges: Legacy code coverage, inconsistent framework use, developer awareness.
records.strategic_risks: Code injection, data corruption, information disclosure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Universal across application stack; requires coding standards and validation libraries.
records.rationale_summary: Validation bypasses or rule drift expose injection and data manipulation paths.
records.observations: Essential secure-coding control; forms backbone of input sanitation within SSDLC.

records.description: Establishes a consistent method to evaluate the cybersecurity posture and resilience of all third-party providers before engagement.
records.objective: Identify vulnerabilities and governance gaps introduced through vendor relationships.
records.key_challenges: Supplier transparency, questionnaire fatigue, inconsistent scoring models.
records.strategic_risks: Supply-chain compromise, contractual exposure, systemic dependency.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Procurement and vendor-management processes across all sectors.
records.rationale_summary: Without structured risk assessment, vendor exposure remains opaque and unverified.
records.observations: Foundation for all downstream vendor-security processes; informs continuous monitoring controls.

records.description: Embeds explicit security, confidentiality, and incident-reporting obligations within vendor and outsourcing contracts.
records.objective: Establish enforceable minimum controls and liability boundaries.
records.key_challenges: Legal interpretation variance, update cycles, jurisdictional differences.
records.strategic_risks: Regulatory breach, weak recourse for non-compliance, unmanaged subcontractors.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Contract formation and renewal across supply-chain tiers.
records.rationale_summary: Weak contractual obligations or outdated clauses cause enforcement and reporting breakdowns.
records.observations: Serves as governance backbone for third-party oversight; aligns with ISO A.15 and DORA 3.

records.description: Implements continuous or periodic assessment of vendor-security posture through attestations, scans, or telemetry feeds.
records.objective: Detect material changes in risk exposure or control degradation over time.
records.key_challenges: Data timeliness, monitoring cost, third-party cooperation.
records.strategic_risks: Blind-spot persistence, outdated assurance data, delayed incident awareness.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Post-onboarding oversight across managed services and SaaS suppliers.
records.rationale_summary: Failure to continuously review third-party posture creates untracked deterioration of assurance.
records.observations: Critical to resilience of extended enterprise; integrates with Telemetry & Signal Console.

records.description: Enforces logical and physical separation of vendor credentials, sessions, and privileges from internal accounts.
records.objective: Prevent unauthorised cross-access and contain vendor-origin breaches.
records.key_challenges: Shared accounts, temporary access sprawl, inadequate audit trails.
records.strategic_risks: Privilege escalation, insider collusion, uncontrolled data movement.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Multi-tenant and hybrid infrastructures using outsourced administration.
records.rationale_summary: Vendors granted broad access without segmentation amplify cross-tenant exposure. Cross-tenant mapping and identity hygiene prevent orphaned external access paths.
records.observations: Complements PAM and MFA; foundational to zero-trust vendor access.

records.description: Ensures vendor incident-response plans integrate with organisational escalation, communication, and forensics workflows.
records.objective: Achieve coordinated containment and transparency during shared incidents.
records.key_challenges: Contractual clarity, cross-time-zone coordination, inconsistent notification timing.
records.strategic_risks: Prolonged outages, duplicated effort, regulatory sanction for delayed disclosure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Outsourced service arrangements, managed SOC, and cloud-provider relationships.
records.rationale_summary: Misaligned playbooks and delayed cross-boundary communication hinder joint containment. Coordinated breach-reporting across partners prevents legal and timing misalignment.
records.observations: Strengthens operational resilience; reinforces shared-responsibility model.

records.description: Defines structured off-boarding procedures for vendors, including data return, credential revocation, and access decommissioning.
records.objective: Prevent post-contract data leakage and residual-access risk.
records.key_challenges: Data-erasure verification, multi-system dependencies, incomplete audit trails.
records.strategic_risks: Persistent credentials, data-retention breaches, reputational damage.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Contract end-of-life and service transition phases.
records.rationale_summary: Incomplete deprovisioning and unclear ownership extend residual risk post-contract.
records.observations: Completes vendor-risk lifecycle; essential for GDPR and DORA compliance closure.

records.description: Conducts simulated phishing exercises and provides adaptive training to strengthen user awareness and reporting culture.
records.objective: Reduce susceptibility to social engineering through practical reinforcement and metrics-based feedback.
records.key_challenges: User fatigue, inconsistent reinforcement, metric misinterpretation.
records.strategic_risks: Credential compromise, malware infiltration, insider-assisted attacks.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Organisation-wide; integral to workforce security programmes.
records.rationale_summary: Repetitive or uncontextualised training desensitises staff, weakening vigilance and oversight.
records.observations: Foundational behavioural safeguard; complements technical email-security measures.

records.description: Implements behavioural analytics and escalation procedures to detect and respond to insider misuse or data exfiltration.
records.objective: Identify anomalous user activity and reduce harm from negligent or malicious insiders.
records.key_challenges: Privacy constraints, alert fatigue, false positives.
records.strategic_risks: Data loss, reputational damage, regulatory non-compliance.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All organisational layers; most effective when linked with HR and compliance functions.
records.rationale_summary: Without continuous behavioural and contextual analytics, insider misuse goes undetected.
records.observations: Blends technical and behavioural data; success depends on cultural maturity and governance clarity.

records.description: Integrates security cues and safe defaults within user interfaces to reduce behavioural errors and accidental exposures.
records.objective: Guide secure behaviour by design rather than relying solely on training.
records.key_challenges: Balancing usability with control enforcement, inconsistent UX patterns, resource constraints.
records.strategic_risks: Misconfiguration, user bypass of controls, cognitive overload.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Software and platform development with user interaction layers.
records.rationale_summary: Complex UX or poor workflow design encourages circumvention of intended security controls.
records.observations: Reinforces ‚Äúsecure usability‚Äù principle; supports risk reduction through intuitive design.

records.description: Establishes behavioural norms for digital interactions to detect anomalies or shifts that may indicate compromise or stress.
records.objective: Enable early detection of behavioural deviations linked to insider threat or burnout.
records.key_challenges: Privacy balance, false correlation, limited contextual data.
records.strategic_risks: Insider risk escalation, reduced morale, trust erosion.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Internal analytics programmes; best integrated with employee wellbeing and HR processes.
records.rationale_summary: Drift in behavioural patterns or overconfidence in baseline models causes latent exposure.
records.observations: Bridge between cyber analytics and human factors; fosters proactive intervention culture.

records.description: Establishes confidential, non-punitive mechanisms for employees to report security incidents or suspicious behaviour.
records.objective: Encourage timely reporting and cultural trust without fear of retribution.
records.key_challenges: Perceived retaliation risk, inconsistent follow-up, awareness gaps.
records.strategic_risks: Unreported incidents, delayed containment, regulatory non-disclosure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Universal organisational policy; must integrate with ethics and HR frameworks.
records.rationale_summary: Staff hesitate to report anomalies if reporting pathways are unclear or culturally unsafe.
records.observations: Cultural linchpin of behavioural security; reinforces accountability and openness.

records.description: Implements processes and tooling to identify workload imbalance or stress conditions linked to security control failures.
records.objective: Maintain staff effectiveness and reduce error likelihood under operational stress.
records.key_challenges: Privacy compliance, subjective data accuracy, lack of organisational focus.
records.strategic_risks: Operational error, oversight fatigue, insider negligence.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Security operations, IT administration, and high-intensity response functions.
records.rationale_summary: Human exhaustion reduces detection performance and coordination quality across teams.
records.observations: Often overlooked resilience layer; vital for sustaining human performance in defence environments.

records.description: Establishes and maintains a unified, documented set of security policies governing behaviour, technology, and governance expectations.
records.objective: Provide authoritative guidance and accountability for security obligations across the organisation.
records.key_challenges: Policy sprawl, poor version control, limited enforcement visibility.
records.strategic_risks: Inconsistent control adoption, regulatory non-compliance, audit failure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applies enterprise-wide; foundation for certification readiness and cultural consistency.
records.rationale_summary: Outdated or inconsistent policies create control drift and weak governance visibility.
records.observations: Anchors every domain of the CRT catalogue; direct alignment with ISO 27001 Clause 5 and Annex A.5.

records.description: Defines a repeatable method for identifying, analysing, and prioritising cyber-risk scenarios across organisational assets.
records.objective: Ensure proportional, evidence-based allocation of control investment and effort.
records.key_challenges: Subjectivity, data scarcity, inconsistent scoring models.
records.strategic_risks: Mis-prioritised defences, poor resource allocation, strategic blind spots.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Organisation-wide risk and assurance programmes.
records.rationale_summary: Static or incomplete assessment models lead to misplaced confidence and poor prioritisation. Governance controls ensure AI and change management remain traceable and risk-aligned.
records.observations: Core reference for aligning with NIST CSF Identify function (ID.RA).

records.description: Establishes accountability, oversight, and data-handling standards to ensure privacy obligations under frameworks such as GDPR or CCPA.
records.objective: Protect personal and sensitive data while demonstrating compliance transparency.
records.key_challenges: Cross-border data flows, consent management, continuous compliance.
records.strategic_risks: Legal sanctions, loss of trust, reputational harm.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All business functions processing personal or regulated data.
records.rationale_summary: Poor governance on data lineage and tagging causes privacy breaches and compliance exposure. Privacy-governance frameworks mediate conflicting regional disclosure laws.
records.observations: Integrates legal, operational, and technical safeguards; aligned with ISO 27701.

records.description: Establishes procedures and tooling for continuous oversight of control performance and compliance status.
records.objective: Detect deviation from mandated frameworks or internal policy obligations.
records.key_challenges: Data fragmentation, report latency, incomplete scope.
records.strategic_risks: Audit failure, non-compliance penalties, management blind spots.
records.deployment_exposure_context: GRC platforms and compliance teams; links directly with assurance processes.
records.rationale_summary: Weak assurance processes prevent visibility of ongoing control deterioration. Compliance reporting ensures timely, jurisdiction-appropriate notifications.
records.observations: Supports DORA and COBIT governance alignment; critical for board-level oversight.

records.description: Extends compliance checks and attestations to critical suppliers and outsourced partners.
records.objective: Confirm external entities maintain equivalent levels of control maturity and compliance posture.
records.key_challenges: Data-sharing reluctance, uneven jurisdictional requirements.
records.strategic_risks: Regulatory exposure through suppliers, fragmented oversight.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Third-party governance and procurement processes.
records.rationale_summary: Vendors unaligned with internal standards weaken organisational compliance posture.
records.observations: Bridges regulatory oversight between CRT-G-05 (Vendor Risk) and compliance domains.

records.description: Defines structured timelines, escalation criteria, and authority-specific notification templates for security incidents.
records.objective: Ensure timely, transparent, and compliant disclosure to regulators, partners, and affected parties.
records.key_challenges: Jurisdictional variance, incomplete impact assessment, communication clarity.
records.strategic_risks: Legal non-compliance, reputational damage, operational disruption.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applies to all digital-service providers and regulated entities.
records.rationale_summary: Lack of clarity on escalation criteria and timing leads to late or incomplete breach disclosures.
records.observations: Harmonises with GDPR Articles 33‚Äì34 and DORA incident-reporting mandates.

records.description: Establishes inventory, configuration, and lifecycle controls for Internet of Things and operational-technology assets.
records.objective: Contain and mitigate exposure introduced by network-connected devices.
records.key_challenges: Firmware visibility, update constraints, shadow IoT proliferation.
records.strategic_risks: Lateral-movement compromise, privacy breaches, physical disruption.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Manufacturing, facilities, healthcare, and any mixed OT/IT environments.
records.rationale_summary: Unmanaged device sprawl and vendor lock-in introduce unpatchable, long-tail risk.
records.observations: Extends perimeter visibility to embedded systems; aligns with NIST IR 8228.

records.description: Defines integrity-checking, key-management, and data-obfuscation practices for blockchain-based systems.
records.objective: Preserve data authenticity and privacy across distributed-ledger environments.
records.key_challenges: Key loss, immutability of sensitive data, governance fragmentation.
records.strategic_risks: Data-exposure irreversibility, protocol vulnerabilities, compliance gaps.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Smart-contract and digital-asset platforms.
records.rationale_summary: Weak key custody or consensus errors erode cryptographic trust foundations.
records.observations: Ensures verifiable integrity while mitigating over-transparency risks.

records.description: Implements governance and trust validation for federated and decentralised identity models.
records.objective: Ensure secure interoperability and revocation control across multiple domains.
records.key_challenges: Token-standard divergence, issuer trust, cross-domain liability.
records.strategic_risks: Identity takeover, replay attacks, trust-anchor collapse.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Cross-organisation SSO, government-ID federations, decentralised ID systems.
records.rationale_summary: Federation logic drift or token re-use undermines identity assurance chains.
records.observations: Foundational to zero-trust architectures; links to NIST SP 800-63 and W3C DID models.

records.description: Applies controls for dataset integrity, model drift detection, and interpretability assurance in AI systems.
records.objective: Maintain trust, fairness, and traceability of automated decision processes.
records.key_challenges: Opaque logic paths, bias propagation, data-poisoning detection.
records.strategic_risks: Regulatory exposure, ethical misuse, systemic propagation of error.
records.deployment_exposure_context: AI-enabled analytics, fraud detection, and automation workflows.
records.rationale_summary: Unvalidated model inputs or explainability gaps distort interpretability and trust. Governance checkpoints and explainability validation maintain accountability in AI-driven control loops.
records.observations: Bridges technical and governance domains; aligned with NIST AI RMF.

records.control_name: AI System Hardening and Abuse Prevention
records.description: Implements technical and procedural safeguards to detect, prevent, and respond to malicious prompt injection, model manipulation, or autonomous exploit chaining within AI systems.
records.objective: Preserve integrity, confidentiality, and safe operation of AI systems under adversarial or abnormal conditions.
records.key_challenges: Dynamic threat vectors, opaque model behaviours, dependency on third-party model supply chains, difficulty verifying prompt and data integrity.
records.strategic_risks: Compromised AI decisioning, automated exploit escalation, reputational damage, breach of safety or ethics thresholds.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applied to internal and third-party AI models, APIs, and autonomous logic layers operating in production or hybrid cloud environments.
records.use_case_scope: Model hosting environments, AI inference pipelines, agent orchestration systems, prompt gateways, and embedded ML integrations.
records.rationale_summary: Reinforces defensive depth for AI systems by addressing model-level, data-level, and behavioural exploitation pathways. Enables early detection of adversarial activity and controlled containment of AI-driven incidents.
records.observations: Extendable to LLMs, generative models, and autonomous agents. Integration with runtime telemetry and provenance tracking is critical.

records.control_name: AI Output Safety and Human-Oversight Controls
records.description: Establishes layered safeguards ensuring that AI-generated outputs, recommendations, or automations undergo context validation, human-oversight review, and risk scoring before execution or dissemination.
records.objective: Ensure human accountability, contextual accuracy, and ethical safety in AI-mediated outcomes.
records.key_challenges: Over-reliance on automated logic, context drift, bias amplification, limited interpretability, and inconsistent human oversight.
records.strategic_risks: Harmful or misleading outputs, operational disruption, regulatory exposure, and reputational degradation.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Applied across AI-assisted decision engines, automated communication systems, workflow orchestration, and public-facing AI interfaces.
records.use_case_scope: AI content generation, financial or operational recommendations, autonomous control actions, and interactive user-facing models.
records.rationale_summary: Introduces governance guardrails and human-in-the-loop validation to prevent AI systems from executing or communicating unsafe, biased, or contextually incorrect actions.
records.observations: Complements CRT-C-0046 and CRT-C-0063; together they provide a full AI-resilience triad (integrity, explainability, oversight).

records.description: Applies isolation, authentication, and telemetry standards to distributed edge-node environments.
records.objective: Reduce attack propagation between central and peripheral nodes.
records.key_challenges: Hardware diversity, latency constraints, limited monitoring reach.
records.strategic_risks: Lateral compromise, configuration drift, uncoordinated patch cycles.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Edge-IoT, 5G MEC, and industrial gateways.
records.rationale_summary: Edge deployments decentralise risk visibility and introduce control fragmentation.
records.observations: Integrates network-and-device hygiene; critical for near-real-time systems.

records.description: Models multi-layered interdependencies to test resilience under cascading-failure scenarios.
records.objective: Quantify compound impact and evaluate control-chain saturation thresholds.
records.key_challenges: Complex data integration, limited historical precedents, simulation fidelity.
records.strategic_risks: Underestimated exposure, chain-reaction failures, policy misalignment.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Cross-infrastructure, financial-services, and public-sector ecosystems.
records.rationale_summary: Overconfidence in resilience metrics or under-tested dependencies masks cascade exposure. Scenario simulation and AI model auditing sustain operational confidence.
records.observations: Connects cyber resilience with systemic-risk regulation; aligns with DORA and FCA operational-resilience guidance.

records.description: Aggregates and correlates telemetry across networks, endpoints, and applications to detect suspicious or anomalous activity.
records.objective: Provide continuous visibility and accelerate threat discovery before impact escalation.
records.key_challenges: Signal overload, false positives, siloed data sources.
records.strategic_risks: Missed detection, delayed containment, operational paralysis.
records.deployment_exposure_context: SOC and hybrid-cloud observability environments.
records.rationale_summary: Poorly aligned log sources or decaying detection logic delay anomaly visibility. Extended telemetry validation and secure forwarding reduce event-stream tampering and silent loss. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure.
records.observations: Foundational control supporting all CRT domains; aligns with NIST CSF DE.AE.

records.description: Defines structured playbooks, escalation routes, and communication templates for security incidents.
records.objective: Coordinate technical, legal, and communication responses efficiently under pressure.
records.key_challenges: Unclear roles, incomplete data, cross-team latency.
records.strategic_risks: Extended outage, stakeholder confusion, legal exposure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All operational domains; integrated with continuity and crisis-management plans.
records.rationale_summary: Lack of rehearsal and ownership clarity leads to fragmented response and slow restoration.
records.observations: Maps directly to ISO 27035 and NIST SP 800-61 Incident-Handling Guide.

records.description: Implements continuous vulnerability assessment and coordinated patch cycles across assets.
records.objective: Reduce exposure window between disclosure and remediation.
records.key_challenges: Legacy systems, operational downtime, fragmented ownership.
records.strategic_risks: Known-vulnerability exploitation, compliance breach.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Hybrid infrastructure; requires asset and CMDB integration.
records.rationale_summary: Weak patch cadence and asset tracking increase exploit windows.
records.observations: Directly supports CIS Controls 3 and 7; essential for preventive resilience.

records.description: Consumes, normalises, and correlates threat-intelligence feeds with internal telemetry for proactive defence.
records.objective: Enable anticipatory response and contextual situational awareness.
records.key_challenges: Feed quality, duplication, integration overhead.
records.strategic_risks: Delayed detection of emerging threats, wasted analytic effort.
records.deployment_exposure_context: SOC, SIEM, and Threat-Hunting operations.
records.rationale_summary: Uncorrelated feeds or model bias cause alert fatigue and misinterpretation. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure. Dependency and data-integrity checks sustain reliable analytics and prevent feedback-loop amplification.
records.observations: Aligns with MITRE ATT&CK and threat-intel sharing (STIX/TAXII) standards.

records.description: Formalises the capture of root causes, remediation outcomes, and systemic-improvement actions after incidents.
records.objective: Transform reactive lessons into proactive resilience improvements.
records.key_challenges: Poor documentation, repetition of past errors, cultural inertia.
records.strategic_risks: Recurring vulnerabilities, audit findings, knowledge loss.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Post-incident review processes linked to risk registers.
records.rationale_summary: Missed review cycles or overconfidence in restoration mask latent risk.
records.observations: Feeds directly into continuous-improvement loops (ISO 27001 PDCA).

records.description: Establishes coordinated communication channels, approval hierarchies, and external messaging protocols during crises.
records.objective: Protect trust and ensure consistent internal and external messaging under stress.
records.key_challenges: Message latency, conflicting narratives, lack of prepared templates.
records.strategic_risks: Public misinformation, stakeholder panic, regulatory repercussions.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Executive and communications functions integrated with incident response.
records.rationale_summary: Lack of communication structure fuels confusion, reputational damage, and delayed action.
records.observations: Bridges cyber response and corporate reputation management.

records.description: Defines coordinated communication, stakeholder notification, and decision authority during recovery operations to maintain confidence and clarity across internal and external audiences.
records.objective: Ensure consistent, timely, and authoritative information flow during post-incident recovery.
records.key_challenges: Conflicting priorities, unclear authority, fragmented reporting, and lack of real-time situational awareness.
records.strategic_risks: Reputational damage, regulatory non-compliance, delayed recovery, and stakeholder mistrust.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise crisis-management and incident-response programmes across digital, operational, and communications functions.
records.use_case_scope: Business continuity, cybersecurity incident recovery, stakeholder communications, regulatory notifications.
records.rationale_summary: Strengthens the communication and coordination interface between recovery teams and leadership to maintain stakeholder confidence and compliance obligations.
records.observations: Must integrate with both crisis-response (RS.CO) and recovery-plan (RC.CO) procedures.

records.description: Implements layered access controls (badging, biometrics, CCTV) and visitor-management procedures for all data-centre and comms-room environments.
records.objective: Restrict physical access to critical infrastructure and maintain full audit traceability.
records.key_challenges: Shared-facility dependency, vendor oversight, insider risk.
records.strategic_risks: Asset compromise, hardware tampering, service disruption.
records.deployment_exposure_context: On-premise and colocation data centres.
records.rationale_summary: Physical access weaknesses or poor audit coverage expose sensitive environments.
records.observations: Baseline physical-layer safeguard; aligned with ISO 27001 Annex A.11.

records.description: Defines configuration baselines, encryption requirements, and remote-wipe capabilities for corporate and BYOD devices.
records.objective: Prevent data leakage or compromise via portable endpoints.
records.key_challenges: User non-compliance, fragmented OS versions, limited telemetry.
records.strategic_risks: Credential theft, regulatory breach, data-loss exposure.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Workforce mobility, hybrid-work models.
records.rationale_summary: Portable devices expand attack surface and often bypass classification or patch routines.
records.observations: Interfaces with access-control domains (CRT-G-02); core to zero-trust edge enforcement.

records.description: Maintains a verified inventory of all physical hardware assets, linking serials, locations, and ownership to configuration records.
records.objective: Enable accountability, loss detection, and lifecycle tracking.
records.key_challenges: Shadow assets, disposal verification, integration with CMDB.
records.strategic_risks: Asset theft, configuration drift, audit gaps.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise IT and OT estates.
records.rationale_summary: Incomplete asset inventories enable untracked devices and unmanaged dependencies. Comprehensive asset and dependency registers reveal hidden inter-system reliance.
records.observations: Complements CRT-C-0051 (Vulnerability Management) and supports ISO 55000 alignment.

records.description: Establishes environmental safeguards for temperature, humidity, power, and water ingress, with real-time alerts and redundancy triggers.
records.objective: Maintain operational stability and hardware longevity.
records.key_challenges: Sensor calibration, alert fatigue, maintenance windows.
records.strategic_risks: Hardware degradation, unplanned outage, data loss.
records.deployment_exposure_context: Data-centre and equipment-room operations.
records.rationale_summary: Environmental failures cause cascading disruption, particularly where backup systems are co-located. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure. Environmental monitoring exposes cascading dependencies and avoids reciprocal failures.
records.observations: Integrates with business-continuity and facilities-management frameworks.

records.description: Captures and retains logs from physical-access systems and CCTV to support investigation and compliance.
records.objective: Provide auditable evidence of facility-access events.
records.key_challenges: Retention limits, privacy regulation, storage capacity.
records.strategic_risks: Lost audit trail, undetected intrusion, legal liability.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All secure and restricted facilities.
records.rationale_summary: Lack of surveillance integration undermines forensic traceability and policy enforcement.
records.observations: Essential to forensic readiness and legal defensibility.

records.description: Defines geographic redundancy, failover infrastructure, and contingency arrangements for sustained service availability.
records.objective: Ensure operational continuity following facility or environmental failure.
records.key_challenges: Cost justification, replication latency, multi-vendor coordination.
records.strategic_risks: Extended downtime, data unavailability, reputational impact.
records.deployment_exposure_context: All critical business and IT operations.
records.rationale_summary: Weak redundancy posture or shared-region dependency increases systemic failure impact. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure. Structured recovery tests and dependency audits validate multi-path restoration.
records.observations: Completes the resilience-layer chain; aligns with ISO 22301 and DORA continuity requirements.

records.description: Establishes policy requirements for backup creation, encryption, off-site storage, and periodic restoration testing to ensure recoverability and compliance with continuity objectives.
records.objective: Maintain reliable data recoverability through verifiable, policy-driven backup and restoration practices.
records.key_challenges: Incomplete coverage, testing neglect, dependency on third-party infrastructure, and misaligned recovery objectives.
records.strategic_risks: Data loss, prolonged downtime, compliance failure, or financial impact from recovery delay.
records.deployment_exposure_context: On-premise and cloud-hosted infrastructure, backup appliances, and managed storage providers.
records.use_case_scope: Enterprise data protection, cloud backup orchestration, disaster-recovery planning, regulatory continuity testing.
records.rationale_summary: Embeds governance oversight into technical backup operations, ensuring recoverability validation and alignment with strategic continuity objectives.
records.observations: Complements CRT-C-0060 (Backup Facility and Redundancy Planning) by formalising policy assurance and recovery testing cadence.

records.description: Control settings incorrectly implemented or inconsistent with baseline; recurring deviation after updates.
records.indicative_signals: Configuration drift detected; repeated deviations from baseline; rollback events increasing.
records.rationale: Configuration drift reflects unmanaged change, indicating control execution is inconsistent or bypassed.
records.notes: Configuration baselines, segmentation policies, and continuous monitoring reduce setup drift and inconsistent enforcement.

records.description: Delay in applying security updates or firmware; exposure window widened.
records.indicative_signals: Patch backlog > threshold; recurring ‚Äúout-of-date‚Äù alerts; known CVEs unpatched.
records.rationale: Patch backlog exposes systems to known vulnerabilities and signals weak update discipline.
records.notes: Integrated vulnerability and patch workflows minimise exposure from delayed updates.

records.description: Compromise of credentials through phishing, malware, or reuse across systems.
records.indicative_signals: Multiple failed logins followed by success; anomalous geolocation; MFA bypass events.
records.rationale: Abnormal login patterns or MFA bypass attempts suggest compromised credentials in use.
records.notes: Strong credential hygiene, adaptive authentication, and mobile safeguards reduce theft probability.

records.description: Over-used or easily phished multi-factor tokens; push-fatigue exploitation.
records.indicative_signals: Excessive push notifications; repeated MFA prompts ignored; token reuse in logs.
records.rationale: Repetitive MFA prompts and reused tokens imply user fatigue or token interception risk.
records.notes: Multi-factor rotation and contextual authorisation detect fatigue or replay attempts.

records.description: Legitimate access abused for unauthorised activity or data exfiltration.
records.indicative_signals: Data access outside normal hours; privileged downloads; abnormal copy activity.
records.rationale: Irregular data-access events imply misuse of legitimate privileges or insider activity.
records.notes: Behavioural analytics and physical access logging constrain privileged misuse.

records.description: Unauthorised increase in access level due to flawed permissions or exploits.
records.indicative_signals: Sudden role changes; privilege escalation alerts; ACL modifications without ticket.
records.rationale: Sudden privilege changes without justification indicate potential escalation or control gaps.
records.notes: Privilege lifecycle governance limits unauthorised elevation paths.

records.description: Critical events not captured, parsed, or correlated; gaps in audit trail.
records.indicative_signals: Missing or truncated logs; gaps in time sequence; uncorrelated alert spikes.
records.rationale: Missing or incomplete logs prevent detection and post-incident analysis.
records.notes: Unified telemetry and anomaly detection ensure high-fidelity event capture.

records.description: Backups damaged, encrypted, or unverified; restoration integrity uncertain.
records.indicative_signals: Backup verification errors; checksum mismatches; failed restore tests.
records.rationale: Failed restore or checksum errors show backups may be unusable during recovery.
records.notes: Environmental isolation and redundancy validation protect restoration integrity.

records.description: Third-party outage or compromise impacts dependent internal controls.
records.indicative_signals: Third-party outage notices; SLA breach alerts; dependency-chain failures.
records.rationale: Vendor service disruptions or SLA breaches highlight over-reliance on third parties.
records.notes: Multi-vendor oversight and tested recovery plans reduce single-point-of-failure risk.

records.description: Vulnerability introduced through evolving inter-system communication.
records.indicative_signals: API errors after update; schema mismatch; integration heartbeat failures.
records.rationale: Integration failures or API drift reveal insecure inter-system dependencies.
records.notes: Secure API gateways and integration governance detect unauthorised calls or schema drift.

records.description: Unauthorised tools or services bypass governance and monitoring.
records.indicative_signals: Unregistered SaaS traffic; unmanaged endpoints; unknown DNS calls.
records.rationale: Unmanaged tools indicate poor asset governance and hidden exposure points.
records.notes: Awareness programs and asset inventories expose unsanctioned applications.

records.description: Incorrect or missing sensitivity tagging leads to mis-handled data.
records.indicative_signals: Files missing sensitivity labels; inconsistent metadata; DLP mis-tags.
records.rationale: Inconsistent data labelling undermines confidentiality and DLP effectiveness.
records.notes: Enforced classification policy and device tagging mitigate unlabelled data flow.

records.description: Data exposure via external partner platform or integration point.
records.indicative_signals: External file-sharing detected; data found on partner domains; leakage alerts.
records.rationale: External file sharing or partner leaks point to insufficient third-party safeguards.
records.notes: Vendor assessments and integrated response protocols contain cross-boundary leaks.

records.description: Encryption or signing keys exposed, reused, or weakly protected.
records.indicative_signals: Key reuse events; expired certificates; unauthorized key export logs.
records.rationale: Key reuse or expired certificates compromise encryption trust chains.
records.notes: Encryption-key rotation and protected transport maintain cryptographic trust.

records.description: ACLs overly permissive; conflicting roles or group inheritance.
records.indicative_signals: Overlapping group permissions; broad ‚Äúany‚Äù access rules; orphaned accounts.
records.rationale: Broad or conflicting access rules create privilege creep and lateral exposure.
records.notes: Periodic review of logical and physical ACLs ensures least-privilege alignment.

records.description: Lateral movement enabled through trust-zone misconfiguration.
records.indicative_signals: East-west traffic anomaly; lateral movement indicators; VLAN crossover.
records.rationale: Unexpected internal traffic shows segmentation or isolation controls have been bypassed.
records.notes: Layered segmentation and patch discipline prevent lateral compromise.

records.description: Security event occurs without timely alert or escalation.
records.indicative_signals: Alert latency > SLA; missing correlation between detection and incident start.
records.rationale: Late or missing alerts reduce containment speed and increase impact duration.
records.notes: Correlated telemetry and playbook integration accelerate alert response.

records.description: Policy implementation diverges from design intent over time.
records.indicative_signals: Control audit deltas increasing; undocumented process steps; config variance.
records.rationale: Divergence between policy and implementation signals process erosion over time.
records.notes: Continuous assurance and configuration baselining preserve intended control posture.

records.description: Roles, responsibilities, or escalation unclear during crisis.
records.indicative_signals: Delayed incident bridge activation; duplicated ownership emails; missed hand-offs.
records.rationale: Unclear incident roles delay containment and reflect weak operational coordination.
records.notes: Defined roles and rehearsed communication enable cohesive incident response.

records.description: Restoration fails to return systems to a trusted, validated state.
records.indicative_signals: Partial restore success; missing validation reports; residual corruption errors.
records.rationale: Incomplete restoration jeopardises data integrity and continuity assurances.
records.notes: Tested recovery workflows and redundant facilities restore systems to a trusted state.

records.description: Absence of ownership, periodic review, or board visibility.
records.indicative_signals: No control owner listed; overdue review tasks; governance board gap.
records.rationale: Absence of control ownership leads to unmanaged risk and audit failures.
records.notes: Clear ownership and periodic review cycles sustain control accountability.

records.description: Control intent erodes through undocumented procedural change.
records.indicative_signals: Procedure updates unrecorded; staff using obsolete SOPs; version skew.
records.rationale: Untracked procedural updates create ambiguity over current control practice.
records.notes: Structured policy frameworks and risk-methodology alignment prevent silent divergence.

records.description: Control excluded or insufficiently tested within assurance cycle.
records.indicative_signals: Audit scope exclusions unexplained; zero test evidence; missing artefacts.
records.rationale: Missing assurance tests conceal latent control failures from governance view.
records.notes: Integrated logging and audit coverage eliminate untested control zones.

records.description: Context stripped during transfer or transformation; lineage broken.
records.indicative_signals: Metadata tags stripped; inconsistent file labels; manual overrides observed.
records.rationale: Lost sensitivity tags reduce visibility of protected data across systems.
records.notes: Reinforces sensitivity labelling discipline across hybrid environments.

records.description: Identity assertion accepted without proper re-validation.
records.indicative_signals: API transfers without context headers; checksum or lineage loss events.
records.rationale: Missing metadata during transfer breaks lineage and integrity verification.
records.notes: Data-validation and federated-ID frameworks preserve contextual integrity.

records.description: Repetition of training causes message desensitisation.
records.indicative_signals: Unvalidated SAML assertions; federation trust errors; stale certificates.
records.rationale: Federation mis-trust exposes identities to replay or assertion spoofing.
records.notes: Revalidation and signed assertions strengthen federated trust chains.

records.description: Model performance diverges from validation baseline; accuracy loss.
records.indicative_signals: Decline in training participation; repeated phishing test failures.
records.rationale: Low training engagement increases vulnerability to social engineering.
records.notes: Rotational awareness and behavioural metrics sustain engagement.

records.description: Malicious or biased data injected to influence AI behaviour.
records.indicative_signals: Model accuracy drop; data-drift alerts; deviation from baseline metrics.
records.rationale: Model drift erodes detection accuracy and decision reliability.
records.notes: Continuous model validation aligns AI behaviour with operational baselines.

records.description: All workloads depend on single provider region; systemic fragility.
records.indicative_signals: Unexpected weight changes; adversarial sample patterns; data-integrity warnings.
records.rationale: Data poisoning corrupts AI behaviour, creating hidden systemic bias.
records.notes: Data-integrity and adversarial-testing controls detect manipulation attempts.

records.description: Inter-service dependency triggers multi-system outage chain.
