controls.rationale_summary: Internet-facing assets require continuous validation; drift or failed recovery opens attack surface.
controls.observations: Often overlooked in hybrid setups; provides measurable reduction in exposure footprint.

controls.control_name: Secure DNS and Network Traffic Monitoring
controls.description: Utilises DNS filtering, anomaly detection, and encrypted-traffic inspection to identify malicious communication patterns.
controls.objective: Detect command-and-control or data-exfiltration activity early.
controls.key_challenges: Encrypted-traffic visibility, privacy balance, tuning alert thresholds.
controls.strategic_risks: Stealth malware persistence, delayed incident detection, lateral compromise.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Network and cloud gateways; dependent on robust telemetry pipelines.
controls.rationale_summary: Logging and detection lag obscure DNS tunnelling or anomalous traffic patterns.
controls.observations: Enhances situational awareness; key telemetry feed for AI Observation Console.

controls.description: Defines redundancy, failover, and capacity-planning strategies to sustain critical services under fault or attack.
controls.objective: Maintain operational continuity through engineered resilience and contingency design.
controls.key_challenges: Cost constraints, configuration drift, dependency under-mapping.
controls.strategic_risks: Service outage, cascading failure, recovery-time breach.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All infrastructures; vital for regulated and mission-critical environments.
controls.rationale_summary: Concentrated hosting or untested recovery plans amplify outage and continuity risks.
controls.observations: Forms the backbone of recovery architecture; links with metrics dashboard and simulation engine.

controls.description: Establishes and maintains hardened technical baselines for systems, platforms, and cloud services, covering configuration, time synchronisation, service exposure, authentication, logging, and protocol governance. Ensures baselines are version-controlled, enforced, monitored for drift, and aligned with organisational policies, risk expectations, and regulatory requirements.
controls.objective: Provide a consistent, measurable, and enforceable foundation of secure configuration across all technology stacks, enabling early detection of misconfiguration, reducing attack surface, and supporting forensic traceability and operational integrity.
controls.key_challenges: Configuration drift across environments; inconsistent baseline ownership; legacy platforms; cloud/modern stack complexity; lack of automated compliance tooling; gaps between policy requirements and platform enforcement.
controls.strategic_risks: Privilege escalation; silent misconfiguration; timestamp inaccuracies; log integrity failures; broadened attack surface; exploitation of insecure defaults; systemic weaknesses enabling lateral movement.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Configuration drift across environments; inconsistent baseline ownership; legacy platform variance; cloud/provider abstraction gaps; lack of automated compliance validation.
controls.rationale_summary: Misconfigured or unmaintained baselines introduce systemic weaknesses that attackers exploit before higher-order controls activate. Baseline governance ensures technical foundations remain secure, coherent, and aligned with risk posture.
controls.observations: Baseline governance is frequently assumed but rarely implemented consistently; automated compliance drift detection is essential; forms the connective tissue between policy intent, standards, and operational reality.

controls.description: Implements authentication, rate limiting, and payload validation at the API boundary to prevent unauthorised access and abuse.
controls.objective: Safeguard data exchange between internal and external services through consistent policy enforcement.
controls.key_challenges: Token leakage, inconsistent API versioning, weak logging visibility.
controls.strategic_risks: Data exposure, privilege escalation, dependency exploitation.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Cloud-native and hybrid integration layers; applies to microservice and B2B interfaces.
controls.rationale_summary: Gateways fail when integrations drift, vendor endpoints misalign, or trust boundaries blur.
controls.observations: Cornerstone of integration security; API misuse often leads to systemic compromise if not monitored continuously.

controls.description: Integrates security activities‚Äîthreat modelling, code review, dependency scanning‚Äîthroughout the development lifecycle.
controls.objective: Identify and remediate vulnerabilities early in design and build stages.
controls.key_challenges: Developer engagement, tooling consistency, dependency management.
controls.strategic_risks: Vulnerable releases, regulatory exposure, reputational loss.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise development pipelines, DevSecOps, and third-party software integration.
controls.rationale_summary: Development control lapses and poor update discipline allow latent defects and stale playbooks. Development pipelines enforce pre-deployment validation and rollback discipline.
controls.observations: Foundational for shift-left resilience; reinforces secure culture within engineering teams.

controls.description: Enforces identity-aware, role-based access rules at the application tier independent of network perimeter.
controls.objective: Prevent unauthorised access and privilege misuse within application logic.
controls.key_challenges: Policy granularity, custom code bypasses, decentralised access checks.
controls.strategic_risks: Data manipulation, privilege abuse, business-logic exploitation.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Web, SaaS, and internal apps; integral to zero-trust models.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak or misaligned logic in app-layer roles allows privilege overlap and trust gaps.
controls.observations: Complements MFA and fine-grained authorisation; enforces least privilege at transaction level.

controls.description: Evaluates the security posture, dependency mapping, and data exposure of integrated third-party applications.
controls.objective: Identify and manage risk introduced by external APIs, plug-ins, and SaaS dependencies.
controls.key_challenges: Vendor visibility, version drift, lack of contractual assurances.
controls.strategic_risks: Supply-chain compromise, data leakage, compliance gap.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Common across SaaS and hybrid ecosystems; should align with vendor-risk framework.
controls.rationale_summary: Unvetted integrations introduce external exposure and governance ambiguity.
controls.observations: Directly supports vendor-risk domain; cross-links to CRT-C-0025 (Third-Party Risk Assessment Framework).

controls.description: Filters, monitors, and blocks malicious HTTP/S traffic using rule-based and behavioural analytics.
controls.objective: Protect public-facing web applications from injection, cross-site scripting, and protocol abuse.
controls.key_challenges: False positives, bypass through obfuscation, rule maintenance.
controls.strategic_risks: Web defacement, data exfiltration, downtime from exploit attempts.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Internet-facing assets and reverse proxies; integrates with CDN and SIEM.
controls.rationale_summary: Misconfigured WAF rules or overreliance on detection cause coverage gaps.
controls.observations: Critical control for exposed services; functions best when linked to continuous vulnerability management.

controls.description: Establishes a consistent method to evaluate the cybersecurity posture and resilience of all third-party providers before engagement.
controls.objective: Identify vulnerabilities and governance gaps introduced through vendor relationships.
controls.key_challenges: Supplier transparency, questionnaire fatigue, inconsistent scoring models.
controls.strategic_risks: Supply-chain compromise, contractual exposure, systemic dependency.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Procurement and vendor-management processes across all sectors.
controls.rationale_summary: Without structured risk assessment, vendor exposure remains opaque and unverified.
controls.observations: Foundation for all downstream vendor-security processes; informs continuous monitoring controls.

controls.description: Embeds explicit security, confidentiality, and incident-reporting obligations within vendor and outsourcing contracts.
controls.objective: Establish enforceable minimum controls and liability boundaries.
controls.key_challenges: Legal interpretation variance, update cycles, jurisdictional differences.
controls.strategic_risks: Regulatory breach, weak recourse for non-compliance, unmanaged subcontractors.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Contract formation and renewal across supply-chain tiers.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak contractual obligations or outdated clauses cause enforcement and reporting breakdowns.
controls.observations: Serves as governance backbone for third-party oversight; aligns with ISO A.15 and DORA 3.

controls.description: Implements continuous or periodic assessment of vendor-security posture through attestations, scans, or telemetry feeds.
controls.objective: Detect material changes in risk exposure or control degradation over time.
controls.key_challenges: Data timeliness, monitoring cost, third-party cooperation.
controls.strategic_risks: Blind-spot persistence, outdated assurance data, delayed incident awareness.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Post-onboarding oversight across managed services and SaaS suppliers.
controls.rationale_summary: Failure to continuously review third-party posture creates untracked deterioration of assurance.
controls.observations: Critical to resilience of extended enterprise; integrates with Telemetry & Signal Console.

controls.description: Ensures vendor incident-response plans integrate with organisational escalation, communication, and forensics workflows.
controls.objective: Achieve coordinated containment and transparency during shared incidents.
controls.key_challenges: Contractual clarity, cross-time-zone coordination, inconsistent notification timing.
controls.strategic_risks: Prolonged outages, duplicated effort, regulatory sanction for delayed disclosure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Outsourced service arrangements, managed SOC, and cloud-provider relationships.
controls.rationale_summary: Misaligned playbooks and delayed cross-boundary communication hinder joint containment. Coordinated breach-reporting across partners prevents legal and timing misalignment.
controls.observations: Strengthens operational resilience; reinforces shared-responsibility model.

controls.description: Conducts simulated phishing exercises and provides adaptive training to strengthen user awareness and reporting culture.
controls.objective: Reduce susceptibility to social engineering through practical reinforcement and metrics-based feedback.
controls.key_challenges: User fatigue, inconsistent reinforcement, metric misinterpretation.
controls.strategic_risks: Credential compromise, malware infiltration, insider-assisted attacks.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Organisation-wide; integral to workforce security programmes.
controls.rationale_summary: Repetitive or uncontextualised training desensitises staff, weakening vigilance and oversight.
controls.observations: Foundational behavioural safeguard; complements technical email-security measures.

controls.description: Implements behavioural analytics and escalation procedures to detect and respond to insider misuse or data exfiltration.
controls.objective: Identify anomalous user activity and reduce harm from negligent or malicious insiders.
controls.key_challenges: Privacy constraints, alert fatigue, false positives.
controls.strategic_risks: Data loss, reputational damage, regulatory non-compliance.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All organisational layers; most effective when linked with HR and compliance functions.
controls.rationale_summary: Without continuous behavioural and contextual analytics, insider misuse goes undetected.
controls.observations: Blends technical and behavioural data; success depends on cultural maturity and governance clarity.

controls.description: Establishes behavioural norms for digital interactions to detect anomalies or shifts that may indicate compromise or stress.
controls.objective: Enable early detection of behavioural deviations linked to insider threat or burnout.
controls.key_challenges: Privacy balance, false correlation, limited contextual data.
controls.strategic_risks: Insider risk escalation, reduced morale, trust erosion.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Internal analytics programmes; best integrated with employee wellbeing and HR processes.
controls.rationale_summary: Drift in behavioural patterns or overconfidence in baseline models causes latent exposure.
controls.observations: Bridge between cyber analytics and human factors; fosters proactive intervention culture.

controls.description: Establishes confidential, non-punitive mechanisms for employees to report security incidents or suspicious behaviour.
controls.objective: Encourage timely reporting and cultural trust without fear of retribution.
controls.key_challenges: Perceived retaliation risk, inconsistent follow-up, awareness gaps.
controls.strategic_risks: Unreported incidents, delayed containment, regulatory non-disclosure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Universal organisational policy; must integrate with ethics and HR frameworks.
controls.rationale_summary: Staff hesitate to report anomalies if reporting pathways are unclear or culturally unsafe.
controls.observations: Cultural linchpin of behavioural security; reinforces accountability and openness.

controls.description: Implements processes and tooling to identify workload imbalance or stress conditions linked to security control failures.
controls.objective: Maintain staff effectiveness and reduce error likelihood under operational stress.
controls.key_challenges: Privacy compliance, subjective data accuracy, lack of organisational focus.
controls.strategic_risks: Operational error, oversight fatigue, insider negligence.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Security operations, IT administration, and high-intensity response functions.
controls.rationale_summary: Human exhaustion reduces detection performance and coordination quality across teams.
controls.observations: Often overlooked resilience layer; vital for sustaining human performance in defence environments.

controls.description: Establishes and maintains a unified, documented set of security policies governing behaviour, technology, and governance expectations.
controls.objective: Provide authoritative guidance and accountability for security obligations across the organisation.
controls.key_challenges: Policy sprawl, poor version control, limited enforcement visibility.
controls.strategic_risks: Inconsistent control adoption, regulatory non-compliance, audit failure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Applies enterprise-wide; foundation for certification readiness and cultural consistency.
controls.rationale_summary: Outdated or inconsistent policies create control drift and weak governance visibility.
controls.observations: Anchors every domain of the CRT catalogue; direct alignment with ISO 27001 Clause 5 and Annex A.5.

controls.description: Defines a repeatable method for identifying, analysing, and prioritising cyber-risk scenarios across organisational assets.
controls.objective: Ensure proportional, evidence-based allocation of control investment and effort.
controls.key_challenges: Subjectivity, data scarcity, inconsistent scoring models.
controls.strategic_risks: Mis-prioritised defences, poor resource allocation, strategic blind spots.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Organisation-wide risk and assurance programmes.
controls.rationale_summary: Static or incomplete assessment models lead to misplaced confidence and poor prioritisation. Governance controls ensure AI and change management remain traceable and risk-aligned.
controls.observations: Core reference for aligning with NIST CSF Identify function (ID.RA).

controls.description: Establishes accountability, oversight, and data-handling standards to ensure privacy obligations under frameworks such as GDPR or CCPA.
controls.objective: Protect personal and sensitive data while demonstrating compliance transparency.
controls.key_challenges: Cross-border data flows, consent management, continuous compliance.
controls.strategic_risks: Legal sanctions, loss of trust, reputational harm.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All business functions processing personal or regulated data.
controls.rationale_summary: Poor governance on data lineage and tagging causes privacy breaches and compliance exposure. Privacy-governance frameworks mediate conflicting regional disclosure laws.
controls.observations: Integrates legal, operational, and technical safeguards; aligned with ISO 27701.

controls.description: Establishes procedures and tooling for continuous oversight of control performance and compliance status.
controls.objective: Detect deviation from mandated frameworks or internal policy obligations.
controls.key_challenges: Data fragmentation, report latency, incomplete scope.
controls.strategic_risks: Audit failure, non-compliance penalties, management blind spots.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: GRC platforms and compliance teams; links directly with assurance processes.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak assurance processes prevent visibility of ongoing control deterioration. Compliance reporting ensures timely, jurisdiction-appropriate notifications.
controls.observations: Supports DORA and COBIT governance alignment; critical for board-level oversight.

controls.description: Defines structured timelines, escalation criteria, and authority-specific notification templates for security incidents.
controls.objective: Ensure timely, transparent, and compliant disclosure to regulators, partners, and affected parties.
controls.key_challenges: Jurisdictional variance, incomplete impact assessment, communication clarity.
controls.strategic_risks: Legal non-compliance, reputational damage, operational disruption.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Applies to all digital-service providers and regulated entities.
controls.rationale_summary: Lack of clarity on escalation criteria and timing leads to late or incomplete breach disclosures.
controls.observations: Harmonises with GDPR Articles 33‚Äì34 and DORA incident-reporting mandates.

controls.description: Establishes inventory, configuration, and lifecycle controls for Internet of Things and operational-technology assets.
controls.objective: Contain and mitigate exposure introduced by network-connected devices.
controls.key_challenges: Firmware visibility, update constraints, shadow IoT proliferation.
controls.strategic_risks: Lateral-movement compromise, privacy breaches, physical disruption.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Manufacturing, facilities, healthcare, and any mixed OT/IT environments.
controls.rationale_summary: Unmanaged device sprawl and vendor lock-in introduce unpatchable, long-tail risk.
controls.observations: Extends perimeter visibility to embedded systems; aligns with NIST IR 8228.

controls.description: Implements governance and trust validation for federated and decentralised identity models.
controls.objective: Ensure secure interoperability and revocation control across multiple domains.
controls.key_challenges: Token-standard divergence, issuer trust, cross-domain liability.
controls.strategic_risks: Identity takeover, replay attacks, trust-anchor collapse.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Cross-organisation SSO, government-ID federations, decentralised ID systems.
controls.rationale_summary: Federation logic drift or token re-use undermines identity assurance chains.
controls.observations: Foundational to zero-trust architectures; links to NIST SP 800-63 and W3C DID models.

controls.description: Models multi-layered interdependencies to test resilience under cascading-failure scenarios.
controls.objective: Quantify compound impact and evaluate control-chain saturation thresholds.
controls.key_challenges: Complex data integration, limited historical precedents, simulation fidelity.
controls.strategic_risks: Underestimated exposure, chain-reaction failures, policy misalignment.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Cross-infrastructure, financial-services, and public-sector ecosystems.
controls.rationale_summary: Overconfidence in resilience metrics or under-tested dependencies masks cascade exposure. Scenario simulation and AI model auditing sustain operational confidence.
controls.observations: Connects cyber resilience with systemic-risk regulation; aligns with DORA and FCA operational-resilience guidance.

controls.description: Aggregates and correlates telemetry across networks, endpoints, and applications to detect suspicious or anomalous activity.
controls.objective: Provide continuous visibility and accelerate threat discovery before impact escalation.
controls.key_challenges: Signal overload, false positives, siloed data sources.
controls.strategic_risks: Missed detection, delayed containment, operational paralysis.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: SOC and hybrid-cloud observability environments.
controls.rationale_summary: Poorly aligned log sources or decaying detection logic delay anomaly visibility. Extended telemetry validation and secure forwarding reduce event-stream tampering and silent loss. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure.
controls.observations: Foundational control supporting all CRT domains; aligns with NIST CSF DE.AE.

controls.description: Defines structured playbooks, escalation routes, and communication templates for security incidents.
controls.objective: Coordinate technical, legal, and communication responses efficiently under pressure.
controls.key_challenges: Unclear roles, incomplete data, cross-team latency.
controls.strategic_risks: Extended outage, stakeholder confusion, legal exposure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All operational domains; integrated with continuity and crisis-management plans.
controls.rationale_summary: Lack of rehearsal and ownership clarity leads to fragmented response and slow restoration.
controls.observations: Maps directly to ISO 27035 and NIST SP 800-61 Incident-Handling Guide.

controls.description: Implements continuous vulnerability assessment and coordinated patch cycles across assets.
controls.objective: Reduce exposure window between disclosure and remediation.
controls.key_challenges: Legacy systems, operational downtime, fragmented ownership.
controls.strategic_risks: Known-vulnerability exploitation, compliance breach.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Hybrid infrastructure; requires asset and CMDB integration.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak patch cadence and asset tracking increase exploit windows.
controls.observations: Directly supports CIS Controls 3 and 7; essential for preventive resilience.

controls.description: Establishes coordinated communication channels, approval hierarchies, and external messaging protocols during crises.
controls.objective: Protect trust and ensure consistent internal and external messaging under stress.
controls.key_challenges: Message latency, conflicting narratives, lack of prepared templates.
controls.strategic_risks: Public misinformation, stakeholder panic, regulatory repercussions.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Executive and communications functions integrated with incident response.
controls.rationale_summary: Lack of communication structure fuels confusion, reputational damage, and delayed action.
controls.observations: Bridges cyber response and corporate reputation management.

controls.description: Implements layered access controls (badging, biometrics, CCTV) and visitor-management procedures for all data-centre and comms-room environments.
controls.objective: Restrict physical access to critical infrastructure and maintain full audit traceability.
controls.key_challenges: Shared-facility dependency, vendor oversight, insider risk.
controls.strategic_risks: Asset compromise, hardware tampering, service disruption.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: On-premise and colocation data centres.
controls.rationale_summary: Physical access weaknesses or poor audit coverage expose sensitive environments.
controls.observations: Baseline physical-layer safeguard; aligned with ISO 27001 Annex A.11.

controls.description: Defines configuration baselines, encryption requirements, and remote-wipe capabilities for corporate and BYOD devices.
controls.objective: Prevent data leakage or compromise via portable endpoints.
controls.key_challenges: User non-compliance, fragmented OS versions, limited telemetry.
controls.strategic_risks: Credential theft, regulatory breach, data-loss exposure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Workforce mobility, hybrid-work models.
controls.rationale_summary: Portable devices expand attack surface and often bypass classification or patch routines.
controls.observations: Interfaces with access-control domains (CRT-G-02); core to zero-trust edge enforcement.

controls.description: Maintains a verified inventory of all physical hardware assets, linking serials, locations, and ownership to configuration records.
controls.objective: Enable accountability, loss detection, and lifecycle tracking.
controls.key_challenges: Shadow assets, disposal verification, integration with CMDB.
controls.strategic_risks: Asset theft, configuration drift, audit gaps.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Enterprise IT and OT estates.
controls.rationale_summary: Incomplete asset inventories enable untracked devices and unmanaged dependencies. Comprehensive asset and dependency registers reveal hidden inter-system reliance.
controls.observations: Complements CRT-C-0051 (Vulnerability Management) and supports ISO 55000 alignment.

controls.description: Establishes environmental safeguards for temperature, humidity, power, and water ingress, with real-time alerts and redundancy triggers.
controls.objective: Maintain operational stability and hardware longevity.
controls.key_challenges: Sensor calibration, alert fatigue, maintenance windows.
controls.strategic_risks: Hardware degradation, unplanned outage, data loss.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Data-centre and equipment-room operations.
controls.rationale_summary: Environmental failures cause cascading disruption, particularly where backup systems are co-located. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure. Environmental monitoring exposes cascading dependencies and avoids reciprocal failures.
controls.observations: Integrates with business-continuity and facilities-management frameworks.

controls.description: Captures and retains logs from physical-access systems and CCTV to support investigation and compliance.
controls.objective: Provide auditable evidence of facility-access events.
controls.key_challenges: Retention limits, privacy regulation, storage capacity.
controls.strategic_risks: Lost audit trail, undetected intrusion, legal liability.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All secure and restricted facilities.
controls.rationale_summary: Lack of surveillance integration undermines forensic traceability and policy enforcement.
controls.observations: Essential to forensic readiness and legal defensibility.

controls.description: Defines geographic redundancy, failover infrastructure, and contingency arrangements for sustained service availability.
controls.objective: Ensure operational continuity following facility or environmental failure.
controls.key_challenges: Cost justification, replication latency, multi-vendor coordination.
controls.strategic_risks: Extended downtime, data unavailability, reputational impact.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: All critical business and IT operations.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak redundancy posture or shared-region dependency increases systemic failure impact. Mapping shared dependencies and sequencing control execution prevents recursive or circular control failure. Structured recovery tests and dependency audits validate multi-path restoration.
controls.observations: Completes the resilience-layer chain; aligns with ISO 22301 and DORA continuity requirements.

controls.description: Establishes policy requirements for backup creation, encryption, off-site storage, and periodic restoration testing to ensure recoverability and compliance with continuity objectives.
controls.objective: Maintain reliable data recoverability through verifiable, policy-driven backup and restoration practices.
controls.key_challenges: Incomplete coverage, testing neglect, dependency on third-party infrastructure, and misaligned recovery objectives.
controls.strategic_risks: Data loss, prolonged downtime, compliance failure, or financial impact from recovery delay.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: On-premise and cloud-hosted infrastructure, backup appliances, and managed storage providers.
controls.use_case_scope: Enterprise data protection, cloud backup orchestration, disaster-recovery planning, regulatory continuity testing.
controls.rationale_summary: Embeds governance oversight into technical backup operations, ensuring recoverability validation and alignment with strategic continuity objectives.
controls.observations: Complements CRT-C-0060 (Backup Facility and Redundancy Planning) by formalising policy assurance and recovery testing cadence.

controls.description: Establishes and maintains a unified, documented set of security policies governing behaviour, technology, and governance expectations.
controls.objective: Provide authoritative guidance and accountability for security obligations across the organisation.
controls.key_challenges: Policy sprawl, poor version control, limited enforcement visibility.
controls.strategic_risks: Inconsistent control adoption, regulatory non-compliance, audit failure.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Applies enterprise-wide; foundation for certification readiness and cultural consistency.
controls.rationale_summary: Outdated or inconsistent policies create control drift and weak governance visibility.
controls.observations: Anchors every domain of the CRT catalogue; direct alignment with ISO 27001 Clause 5 and Annex A.5.

controls.description: Defines a repeatable method for identifying, analysing, and prioritising cyber-risk scenarios across organisational assets.
controls.objective: Ensure proportional, evidence-based allocation of control investment and effort.
controls.key_challenges: Subjectivity, data scarcity, inconsistent scoring models.
controls.strategic_risks: Mis-prioritised defences, poor resource allocation, strategic blind spots.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Organisation-wide risk and assurance programmes.
controls.rationale_summary: Static or incomplete assessment models lead to misplaced confidence and poor prioritisation. Governance controls ensure AI and change management remain traceable and risk-aligned.
controls.observations: Core reference for aligning with NIST CSF Identify function (ID.RA).

controls.description: Establishes procedures and tooling for continuous oversight of control performance and compliance status.
controls.objective: Detect deviation from mandated frameworks or internal policy obligations.
controls.key_challenges: Data fragmentation, report latency, incomplete scope.
controls.strategic_risks: Audit failure, non-compliance penalties, management blind spots.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: GRC platforms and compliance teams; links directly with assurance processes.
controls.rationale_summary: Weak assurance processes prevent visibility of ongoing control deterioration. Compliance reporting ensures timely, jurisdiction-appropriate notifications.
controls.observations: Supports DORA and COBIT governance alignment; critical for board-level oversight.

controls.description: Models multi-layered interdependencies to test resilience under cascading-failure scenarios.
controls.objective: Quantify compound impact and evaluate control-chain saturation thresholds.
controls.key_challenges: Complex data integration, limited historical precedents, simulation fidelity.
controls.strategic_risks: Underestimated exposure, chain-reaction failures, policy misalignment.
controls.deployment_exposure_context: Cross-infrastructure, financial-services, and public-sector ecosystems.
controls.rationale_summary: Overconfidence in resilience metrics or under-tested dependencies masks cascade exposure. Scenario simulation and AI model auditing sustain operational confidence.
controls.observations: Connects cyber resilience with systemic-risk regulation; aligns with DORA and FCA operational-resilience guidance.

crt_f_in_scope_records.description: CRT-F in-scope records are derived from the resolved CRT-C control set. We extract mapped_failure_ids from CRT-C controls, then attach the full CRT-F rows for those failures.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Unauthorised tools or services bypass governance and monitoring.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Unregistered SaaS traffic; unmanaged endpoints; unknown DNS calls.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Unmanaged tools indicate poor asset governance and hidden exposure points.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Awareness programs and asset inventories expose unsanctioned applications.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Policy implementation diverges from design intent over time.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Control audit deltas increasing; undocumented process steps; config variance.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Divergence between policy and implementation signals process erosion over time.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Continuous assurance and configuration baselining preserve intended control posture.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Absence of ownership, periodic review, or board visibility.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: No control owner listed; overdue review tasks; governance board gap.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Absence of control ownership leads to unmanaged risk and audit failures.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Clear ownership and periodic review cycles sustain control accountability.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Control intent erodes through undocumented procedural change.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Procedure updates unrecorded; staff using obsolete SOPs; version skew.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Untracked procedural updates create ambiguity over current control practice.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Structured policy frameworks and risk-methodology alignment prevent silent divergence.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Control excluded or insufficiently tested within assurance cycle.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Audit scope exclusions unexplained; zero test evidence; missing artefacts.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Missing assurance tests conceal latent control failures from governance view.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Integrated logging and audit coverage eliminate untested control zones.

records_tight_or_focused.description: All workloads depend on single provider region; systemic fragility.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Unexpected weight changes; adversarial sample patterns; data-integrity warnings.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Data poisoning corrupts AI behaviour, creating hidden systemic bias.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Data-integrity and adversarial-testing controls detect manipulation attempts.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Inter-service dependency triggers multi-system outage chain.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: All assets in one CSP region; replication disabled; single-region outage impact.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Regional hosting concentration increases correlated outage risk.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Multi-region redundancy offsets geographic dependency risk.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Devices lack patch or decommission plan; security decay over time.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: API timeouts cascading; dependency latency spikes; queue backlog growth.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Interdependent API timeouts propagate failures across multiple services.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Dependency mapping and fault isolation prevent systemic outage chains.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Incident playbooks untested or unrealistic; stale scenario data.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Cryptographic deprecation warnings; use of non-PQC algorithms.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Legacy cryptography without PQC readiness risks future decryption exposure.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Metrics interpreted without validating data quality or scope.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Exercise overdue; outdated contact lists; test participation < target.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Untested playbooks reduce incident readiness and learning continuity.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Regular scenario exercises preserve procedural readiness.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Service relationships undocumented; cascade or patch blind spot.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Undefined dependency matrix; missing CMDB entries; patch sequencing issues.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Absent dependency mapping hides cumulative risk in change sequencing.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Asset and supply-chain registries reveal transitive dependencies and strengthen systemic-risk modelling.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Human validation missing in AI-driven decision loops.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: No human review of AI output; override thresholds exceeded; audit trail gaps.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Lack of human review of AI output risks automation bias and error reinforcement.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Model-governance controls and risk-assessment frameworks sustain accountability for AI-driven operations.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Emergency or manual fixes circumvent change-approval flow.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Change tickets missing; emergency changes unrecorded; version rollback errors.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Unrecorded emergency changes compromise traceability and rollback safety.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Development lifecycle controls and governance checkpoints enforce traceable configuration changes.

records_tight_or_focused.description: Regulatory reporting timelines or obligations mis-aligned across regions.
records_tight_or_focused.indicative_signals: Conflicting breach notices; inconsistent reporting timelines; legal escalation flags.
records_tight_or_focused.rationale: Inconsistent breach reporting causes regulatory and reputational escalation.
records_tight_or_focused.notes: Privacy-governance and compliance-reporting controls manage conflicting regulatory obligations across regions.

records_broad.description: Control settings incorrectly implemented or inconsistent with baseline; recurring deviation after updates.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Configuration drift detected; repeated deviations from baseline; rollback events increasing.
records_broad.rationale: Configuration drift reflects unmanaged change, indicating control execution is inconsistent or bypassed.
records_broad.notes: Configuration baselines, segmentation policies, and continuous monitoring reduce setup drift and inconsistent enforcement.

records_broad.description: Delay in applying security updates or firmware; exposure window widened.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Patch backlog > threshold; recurring ‚Äúout-of-date‚Äù alerts; known CVEs unpatched.
records_broad.rationale: Patch backlog exposes systems to known vulnerabilities and signals weak update discipline.
records_broad.notes: Integrated vulnerability and patch workflows minimise exposure from delayed updates.

records_broad.description: Compromise of credentials through phishing, malware, or reuse across systems.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Multiple failed logins followed by success; anomalous geolocation; MFA bypass events.
records_broad.rationale: Abnormal login patterns or MFA bypass attempts suggest compromised credentials in use.
records_broad.notes: Strong credential hygiene, adaptive authentication, and mobile safeguards reduce theft probability.

records_broad.description: Over-used or easily phished multi-factor tokens; push-fatigue exploitation.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Excessive push notifications; repeated MFA prompts ignored; token reuse in logs.
records_broad.rationale: Repetitive MFA prompts and reused tokens imply user fatigue or token interception risk.
records_broad.notes: Multi-factor rotation and contextual authorisation detect fatigue or replay attempts.

records_broad.description: Legitimate access abused for unauthorised activity or data exfiltration.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Data access outside normal hours; privileged downloads; abnormal copy activity.
records_broad.rationale: Irregular data-access events imply misuse of legitimate privileges or insider activity.
records_broad.notes: Behavioural analytics and physical access logging constrain privileged misuse.

records_broad.description: Unauthorised increase in access level due to flawed permissions or exploits.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Sudden role changes; privilege escalation alerts; ACL modifications without ticket.
records_broad.rationale: Sudden privilege changes without justification indicate potential escalation or control gaps.
records_broad.notes: Privilege lifecycle governance limits unauthorised elevation paths.

records_broad.description: Critical events not captured, parsed, or correlated; gaps in audit trail.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Missing or truncated logs; gaps in time sequence; uncorrelated alert spikes.
records_broad.rationale: Missing or incomplete logs prevent detection and post-incident analysis.
records_broad.notes: Unified telemetry and anomaly detection ensure high-fidelity event capture.

records_broad.description: Backups damaged, encrypted, or unverified; restoration integrity uncertain.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Backup verification errors; checksum mismatches; failed restore tests.
records_broad.rationale: Failed restore or checksum errors show backups may be unusable during recovery.
records_broad.notes: Environmental isolation and redundancy validation protect restoration integrity.

records_broad.description: Third-party outage or compromise impacts dependent internal controls.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Third-party outage notices; SLA breach alerts; dependency-chain failures.
records_broad.rationale: Vendor service disruptions or SLA breaches highlight over-reliance on third parties.
records_broad.notes: Multi-vendor oversight and tested recovery plans reduce single-point-of-failure risk.

records_broad.description: Vulnerability introduced through evolving inter-system communication.
records_broad.indicative_signals: API errors after update; schema mismatch; integration heartbeat failures.
records_broad.rationale: Integration failures or API drift reveal insecure inter-system dependencies.
records_broad.notes: Secure API gateways and integration governance detect unauthorised calls or schema drift.

records_broad.description: Unauthorised tools or services bypass governance and monitoring.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Unregistered SaaS traffic; unmanaged endpoints; unknown DNS calls.
records_broad.rationale: Unmanaged tools indicate poor asset governance and hidden exposure points.
records_broad.notes: Awareness programs and asset inventories expose unsanctioned applications.

records_broad.description: Incorrect or missing sensitivity tagging leads to mis-handled data.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Files missing sensitivity labels; inconsistent metadata; DLP mis-tags.
records_broad.rationale: Inconsistent data labelling undermines confidentiality and DLP effectiveness.
records_broad.notes: Enforced classification policy and device tagging mitigate unlabelled data flow.

records_broad.description: Data exposure via external partner platform or integration point.
records_broad.indicative_signals: External file-sharing detected; data found on partner domains; leakage alerts.
records_broad.rationale: External file sharing or partner leaks point to insufficient third-party safeguards.
records_broad.notes: Vendor assessments and integrated response protocols contain cross-boundary leaks.

records_broad.description: Encryption or signing keys exposed, reused, or weakly protected.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Key reuse events; expired certificates; unauthorized key export logs.
records_broad.rationale: Key reuse or expired certificates compromise encryption trust chains.
records_broad.notes: Encryption-key rotation and protected transport maintain cryptographic trust.

records_broad.description: ACLs overly permissive; conflicting roles or group inheritance.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Overlapping group permissions; broad ‚Äúany‚Äù access rules; orphaned accounts.
records_broad.rationale: Broad or conflicting access rules create privilege creep and lateral exposure.
records_broad.notes: Periodic review of logical and physical ACLs ensures least-privilege alignment.

records_broad.description: Lateral movement enabled through trust-zone misconfiguration.
records_broad.indicative_signals: East-west traffic anomaly; lateral movement indicators; VLAN crossover.
records_broad.rationale: Unexpected internal traffic shows segmentation or isolation controls have been bypassed.
records_broad.notes: Layered segmentation and patch discipline prevent lateral compromise.

records_broad.description: Security event occurs without timely alert or escalation.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Alert latency > SLA; missing correlation between detection and incident start.
records_broad.rationale: Late or missing alerts reduce containment speed and increase impact duration.
records_broad.notes: Correlated telemetry and playbook integration accelerate alert response.

records_broad.description: Policy implementation diverges from design intent over time.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Control audit deltas increasing; undocumented process steps; config variance.
records_broad.rationale: Divergence between policy and implementation signals process erosion over time.
records_broad.notes: Continuous assurance and configuration baselining preserve intended control posture.

records_broad.description: Roles, responsibilities, or escalation unclear during crisis.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Delayed incident bridge activation; duplicated ownership emails; missed hand-offs.
records_broad.rationale: Unclear incident roles delay containment and reflect weak operational coordination.
records_broad.notes: Defined roles and rehearsed communication enable cohesive incident response.

records_broad.description: Restoration fails to return systems to a trusted, validated state.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Partial restore success; missing validation reports; residual corruption errors.
records_broad.rationale: Incomplete restoration jeopardises data integrity and continuity assurances.
records_broad.notes: Tested recovery workflows and redundant facilities restore systems to a trusted state.

records_broad.description: Absence of ownership, periodic review, or board visibility.
records_broad.indicative_signals: No control owner listed; overdue review tasks; governance board gap.
records_broad.rationale: Absence of control ownership leads to unmanaged risk and audit failures.
records_broad.notes: Clear ownership and periodic review cycles sustain control accountability.

records_broad.description: Control intent erodes through undocumented procedural change.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Procedure updates unrecorded; staff using obsolete SOPs; version skew.
records_broad.rationale: Untracked procedural updates create ambiguity over current control practice.
records_broad.notes: Structured policy frameworks and risk-methodology alignment prevent silent divergence.

records_broad.description: Control excluded or insufficiently tested within assurance cycle.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Audit scope exclusions unexplained; zero test evidence; missing artefacts.
records_broad.rationale: Missing assurance tests conceal latent control failures from governance view.
records_broad.notes: Integrated logging and audit coverage eliminate untested control zones.

records_broad.description: Context stripped during transfer or transformation; lineage broken.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Metadata tags stripped; inconsistent file labels; manual overrides observed.
records_broad.rationale: Lost sensitivity tags reduce visibility of protected data across systems.
records_broad.notes: Reinforces sensitivity labelling discipline across hybrid environments.

records_broad.description: Identity assertion accepted without proper re-validation.
records_broad.indicative_signals: API transfers without context headers; checksum or lineage loss events.
records_broad.rationale: Missing metadata during transfer breaks lineage and integrity verification.
records_broad.notes: Data-validation and federated-ID frameworks preserve contextual integrity.

records_broad.description: Repetition of training causes message desensitisation.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Unvalidated SAML assertions; federation trust errors; stale certificates.
records_broad.rationale: Federation mis-trust exposes identities to replay or assertion spoofing.
records_broad.notes: Revalidation and signed assertions strengthen federated trust chains.

records_broad.description: Malicious or biased data injected to influence AI behaviour.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Model accuracy drop; data-drift alerts; deviation from baseline metrics.
records_broad.rationale: Model drift erodes detection accuracy and decision reliability.
records_broad.notes: Continuous model validation aligns AI behaviour with operational baselines.

records_broad.description: All workloads depend on single provider region; systemic fragility.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Unexpected weight changes; adversarial sample patterns; data-integrity warnings.
records_broad.rationale: Data poisoning corrupts AI behaviour, creating hidden systemic bias.
records_broad.notes: Data-integrity and adversarial-testing controls detect manipulation attempts.

records_broad.description: Inter-service dependency triggers multi-system outage chain.
records_broad.indicative_signals: All assets in one CSP region; replication disabled; single-region outage impact.
records_broad.rationale: Regional hosting concentration increases correlated outage risk.
records_broad.notes: Multi-region redundancy offsets geographic dependency risk.

records_broad.description: Devices lack patch or decommission plan; security decay over time.
records_broad.indicative_signals: API timeouts cascading; dependency latency spikes; queue backlog growth.
records_broad.rationale: Interdependent API timeouts propagate failures across multiple services.
records_broad.notes: Dependency mapping and fault isolation prevent systemic outage chains.

records_broad.description: Legacy cryptography vulnerable to future quantum attacks.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Out-of-support firmware; device inventory mismatch; patch compliance < 80 %.
records_broad.rationale: Unpatched or orphaned IoT devices expand the attack surface unchecked.
records_broad.notes: Lifecycle governance ensures device retirement and patchability.

records_broad.description: Incident playbooks untested or unrealistic; stale scenario data.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Cryptographic deprecation warnings; use of non-PQC algorithms.
records_broad.rationale: Legacy cryptography without PQC readiness risks future decryption exposure.
records_broad.notes: Crypto-agility planning mitigates post-quantum exposure.

records_broad.description: Metrics interpreted without validating data quality or scope.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Exercise overdue; outdated contact lists; test participation < target.
records_broad.rationale: Untested playbooks reduce incident readiness and learning continuity.
records_broad.notes: Regular scenario exercises preserve procedural readiness.

records_broad.description: SIEM rules or filters hide legitimate alerts; signals dropped.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Dashboard anomalies ignored; data-integrity warnings dismissed.
records_broad.rationale: Ignoring anomalous dashboards shows misplaced confidence in metrics.
records_broad.notes: Metrics contextualised with validated data prevent analytic bias.

records_broad.description: Monitoring data missing or corrupted; situational blindness.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Missing telemetry feed; corrupted log stream; heartbeat gaps detected.
records_broad.rationale: Missing telemetry feeds blind monitoring systems to live conditions.
records_broad.notes: Telemetry aggregation, network monitoring, and integrity checks ensure continuity and authenticity of event data.

records_broad.description: Service relationships undocumented; cascade or patch blind spot.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Undefined dependency matrix; missing CMDB entries; patch sequencing issues.
records_broad.rationale: Absent dependency mapping hides cumulative risk in change sequencing.
records_broad.notes: Asset and supply-chain registries reveal transitive dependencies and strengthen systemic-risk modelling.

records_broad.description: Vendor credentials remain active after contract termination.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Active vendor accounts post-termination; stale API keys; orphaned access tokens.
records_broad.rationale: Residual vendor credentials create unmonitored external access paths.
records_broad.notes: Off-boarding workflows and federated-identity hygiene prevent dormant external credentials from persisting.

records_broad.description: Human validation missing in AI-driven decision loops.
records_broad.indicative_signals: No human review of AI output; override thresholds exceeded; audit trail gaps.
records_broad.rationale: Lack of human review of AI output risks automation bias and error reinforcement.
records_broad.notes: Model-governance controls and risk-assessment frameworks sustain accountability for AI-driven operations.

records_broad.description: Failover or continuity exercises skipped or simulated poorly.
records_broad.indicative_signals: DR drill skipped; failover logs absent; RTO/RPO targets unverified.
records_broad.rationale: Skipped recovery drills mask resilience weaknesses until actual failure.
records_broad.notes: Scenario simulation, continuity testing, and systemic-stress exercises verify preparedness under dynamic conditions.

records_broad.description: Emergency or manual fixes circumvent change-approval flow.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Change tickets missing; emergency changes unrecorded; version rollback errors.
records_broad.rationale: Unrecorded emergency changes compromise traceability and rollback safety.
records_broad.notes: Development lifecycle controls and governance checkpoints enforce traceable configuration changes.

records_broad.description: Regulatory reporting timelines or obligations mis-aligned across regions.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Conflicting breach notices; inconsistent reporting timelines; legal escalation flags.
records_broad.rationale: Inconsistent breach reporting causes regulatory and reputational escalation.
records_broad.notes: Privacy-governance and compliance-reporting controls manage conflicting regulatory obligations across regions.

records_broad.description: Two or more controls mutually depend on each other‚Äôs outputs, creating circular fragility.
records_broad.indicative_signals: Recurring circular alerts; dependent control metrics feeding each other.
records_broad.rationale: Circular alert dependencies inflate confidence scores and mask genuine failure.
records_broad.notes: Dependency and recovery mapping prevent recursive control failures during cascading events.

crt_n_in_scope_records.description: CRT-N in-scope records are derived from the resolved CRT-C control set. We extract mapped_compensation_ids from CRT-C controls, then attach the full CRT-N rows for those compensations.

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Establish criteria for using a quantitative approach to cybersecurity risk analysis, and specify probability and exposure formulasEx2: Create and use templates (e.g., a risk register) to document cybersecurity risk information (e.g., risk description, exposure, treatment, and ownership)Ex3: Establish criteria for risk prioritization at the appropriate levels within the enterpriseEx4: Use a consistent list of risk categories to support integrating, aggregating, and comparing cybersecurity risks

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Leaders (e.g., directors) agree on their roles and responsibilities in developing, implementing, and assessing the organization's cybersecurity strategyEx2: Share leaders' expectations regarding a secure and ethical culture, especially when current events present the opportunity to highlight positive or negative examples of cybersecurity risk managementEx3: Leaders direct the CISO to maintain a comprehensive cybersecurity risk strategy and review and update it at least annually and after major eventsEx4: Conduct reviews to ensure adequate authority and coordination among those responsible for managing cybersecurity risk

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Document risk management roles and responsibilities in policyEx2: Document who is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk management activities and how those teams and individuals are to be consulted and informedEx3: Include cybersecurity responsibilities and performance requirements in personnel descriptionsEx4: Document performance goals for personnel with cybersecurity risk management responsibilities, and periodically measure performance to identify areas for improvementEx5: Clearly articulate cybersecurity responsibilities within operations, risk functions, and internal audit functions

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Conduct periodic management reviews to ensure that those given cybersecurity risk management responsibilities have the necessary authorityEx2: Identify resource allocation and investment in line with risk tolerance and responseEx3: Provide adequate and sufficient people, process, and technical resources to support the cybersecurity strategy

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Create, disseminate, and maintain an understandable, usable risk management policy with statements of management intent, expectations, and directionEx2: Periodically review policy and supporting processes and procedures to ensure that they align with risk management strategy objectives and priorities, as well as the high-level direction of the cybersecurity policyEx3: Require approval from senior management on policyEx4: Communicate cybersecurity risk management policy and supporting processes and procedures across the organizationEx5: Require personnel to acknowledge receipt of policy when first hired, annually, and whenever policy is updated

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Update policy based on periodic reviews of cybersecurity risk management results to ensure that policy and supporting processes and procedures adequately maintain risk at an acceptable levelEx2: Provide a timeline for reviewing changes to the organization's risk environment (e.g., changes in risk or in the organization's mission objectives), and communicate recommended policy updatesEx3: Update policy to reflect changes in legal and regulatory requirementsEx4: Update policy to reflect changes in technology (e.g., adoption of artificial intelligence) and changes to the business (e.g., acquisition of a new business, new contract requirements)

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Measure how well the risk management strategy and risk results have helped leaders make decisions and achieve organizational objectivesEx2: Examine whether cybersecurity risk strategies that impede operations or innovation should be adjusted

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Review audit findings to confirm whether the existing cybersecurity strategy has ensured compliance with internal and external requirementsEx2: Review the performance oversight of those in cybersecurity-related roles to determine whether policy changes are necessaryEx3: Review strategy in light of cybersecurity incidents

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is evaluated and reviewed for adjustments needed
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Review key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure that organization-wide policies and procedures achieve objectivesEx2: Review key risk indicators (KRIs) to identify risks the organization faces, including likelihood and potential impactEx3: Collect and communicate metrics on cybersecurity risk management with senior leadership

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Use vulnerability management technologies to identify unpatched and misconfigured softwareEx2: Assess network and system architectures for design and implementation weaknesses that affect cybersecurityEx3: Review, analyze, or test organization-developed software to identify design, coding, and default configuration vulnerabilitiesEx4: Assess facilities that house critical computing assets for physical vulnerabilities and resilience issuesEx5: Monitor sources of cyber threat intelligence for information on new vulnerabilities in products and servicesEx6: Review processes and procedures for weaknesses that could be exploited to affect cybersecurity

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Business leaders and cybersecurity risk management practitioners work together to estimate the likelihood and impact of risk scenarios and record them in risk registersEx2: Enumerate the potential business impacts of unauthorized access to the organization's communications, systems, and data processed in or by those systemsEx3: Account for the potential impacts of cascading failures for systems of systems

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Develop threat models to better understand risks to the data and identify appropriate risk responsesEx2: Prioritize cybersecurity resource allocations and investments based on estimated likelihoods and impacts

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for deciding whether to accept, transfer, mitigate, or avoid riskEx2: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for selecting compensating controls to mitigate riskEx3: Track the progress of risk response implementation (e.g., plan of action and milestones [POA&M], risk register, risk detail report)Ex4: Use risk assessment findings to inform risk response decisions and actionsEx5: Communicate planned risk responses to affected stakeholders in priority order

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Implement and follow procedures for the formal documentation, review, testing, and approval of proposed changes and requested exceptionsEx2: Document the possible risks of making or not making each proposed change, and provide guidance on rolling back changesEx3: Document the risks related to each requested exception and the plan for responding to those risksEx4: Periodically review risks that were accepted based upon planned future actions or milestones

Ex1: Perform self-assessments of critical services that take current threats and TTPs into considerationEx2: Invest in third-party assessments or independent audits of the effectiveness of the organization's cybersecurity program to identify areas that need improvementEx3: Constantly evaluate compliance with selected cybersecurity requirements through automated means

records_tight_or_focused.compensating_name: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities
records_tight_or_focused.implementation_notes: Ex1: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with suppliersEx2: Annually review cybersecurity policies, processes, and procedures to take lessons learned into accountEx3: Use metrics to assess operational cybersecurity performance over time

records_broad.compensating_name: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed
records_broad.implementation_notes: Ex1: Determine a process to track and manage legal and regulatory requirements regarding protection of individuals' information (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, California Consumer Privacy Act, General Data Protection Regulation)Ex2: Determine a process to track and manage contractual requirements for cybersecurity management of supplier, customer, and partner informationEx3: Align the organization's cybersecurity strategy with legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements

records_broad.compensating_name: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices
records_broad.implementation_notes: Ex1: Integrate cybersecurity risk management considerations into human resources processes (e.g., personnel screening, onboarding, change notification, offboarding)Ex2: Consider cybersecurity knowledge to be a positive factor in hiring, training, and retention decisionsEx3: Conduct background checks prior to onboarding new personnel for sensitive roles, and periodically repeat background checks for personnel with such rolesEx4: Define and enforce obligations for personnel to be aware of, adhere to, and uphold security policies as they relate to their roles
